pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi mos pa tha dad pa la mkhas pa mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ sems can gcig sems can grangs med par yang dag par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dad pa'i tshul brjod du med pa'i snang ba'i 'od kyis mos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma lus pa dang / 'gro ba rgya mtsho mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba dang mi dge ba la mos pa tshad med pa la 'jug par bya ba dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi dbang gis yongs su shes par bya ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ skal pa mnyam pa'i mos pa dang / skal pa mi mnyam pa'i mos pa shes pa la 'jug par bya ba dang / mos pa thams cad mos pa gcig tu yang dag par 'jug pa dang / mos pa gcig mos pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ mos pa bla ma dang bcas pa dang / mos pa bla na med pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i mos pa'i bye brag shes pa mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ gnas pa'i mos pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mos pa dang / thun mong gi mos pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mos pa dang / 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mos pa dang / chos thams cad kyi bye brag shin tu shes pa'i dam pa mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ dge ba'i mos pa dang / yangs pa'i mos pa dang / mos pa bar ma dang / tha dad pa dang / nges pa'i mos pa ma lus pa thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes dang / chags pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ rnam par dag pa'i mos pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mos pa dang / yangs pa'i mos pa dang / dog pa'i mos pa dang / phra ba'i mos pa dang / rgya che ba'i mos pa dang / sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi mos pa'i tshul rnam pa tha dad pa la rab tu 'jug par bya ba dang / sems can gcig gi mos pa sna tshogs 'byams klas pa bcu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ rgyud stug po'i mos pa dang / sbyor ba'i mos pa dang / yongs su brtags pa'i mos pa dang / ngang gis rjes su 'brang ba'i mos pa dang / rgyu'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i mos pa dang / rkyen gyi tshogs las byung ba'i mos pa dang / mos pa'i dra ba ma lus pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing yongs su rig pa'i shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, setting aside this example, suppose someone could, in the time of a single instant, know the various different understandings of all the sentient beings in incalculably many worlds in the eastern direction, and went on like this instant after instant for a whole incalculable eon; now suppose a second person can know in a single instant all the differences in sentient beings’ understandings known by the first person in an incalculable eon, and also went on like this (knowing more and more each instant) for an incalculable eon. Now apply this pattern successively up to the tenth person, and also to the other nine directions: the limit of the various different understandings of these sentient beings in the ten directions may be known, but the limit of the virtues of the enlightening being’s first determination on enlightenment cannot be known by anyone. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just: to know the understandings of a particular limited number of sentient beings. They set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment to know the various different understandings of all sentient beings in all worlds. That is, they want to know different understandings are boundless, and that one sentient being’s understanding is equal to countless sentient beings’ understandings; they want to attain the light of knowledge of liberative techniques appropriate to unspeakably many different understandings; they want to know all the individual different understandings in the ocean of sentient beings; they want to know all the infinite various understandings, good and bad, of past, present, and future; they want to know all understandings which resemble each other and those which don’t; they want to know all understandings are one understanding, one understanding is all understandings; they want to attain the enlightened ones’ power of understanding; they want to know the differences between understanding that can be surpassed and understanding that is unexcelled, understanding which has remainder and understanding without remainder, equal understandings and unequal understandings; they want to know the differences between dependent and independent understanding, common understanding and unique understanding, bounded understanding and boundless understanding, differentiated understanding and undifferentiated understanding, good understanding and bad understanding, mundane understanding and transmundane understanding; they want to attain the unhindered knowledge of liberation of the enlightened in respect to all subtle understanding, great understanding, infinite understanding, and understanding of the true state; they want to know, by means of infinite appropriate means, the pure understandings and defiled understandings, broad understandings and summary understandings, fine understandings and coarse understandings, of each and every sentient being in all realms of sentient beings in the ten directions; they want to know deeply secret understandings, expedient understandings, discriminating understandings, spontaneous understandings, understandings that arise according to causes, understandings that arise according to conditions, the networks of all understandings—to know these they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ mos pa sna tshogs kyi dpe tha dad pa snga ma de dag lta zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes par gyur te/ de'i sems gcig bskyed pas 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang po sna tshogs rab tu shes par gyur la/ de lta bu'i tshul du sems bskyed pa re re la shes pas shar phyogs logs su bskal pa grangs med pa zad par byas kyang shar phyogs kyi sems can rnams kyi dbang po sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mthar thug par mi rung la/ tshul de bzhin du mos pa la ji skad du brjod pa bzhin dbang po tha dad pa la yang shes par byas te/ de dag gi dbang po sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni/ phyogs bcur mthar thug par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mtha' med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / sems can de tsam dag gi dbang po sna tshogs shes par bya ba'i phyir byan chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba ma yin gyi/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang po yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o; ; gzhung de bzhin du ji ltar mos pa la brjod pa de bzhin dbang po rnams la yang shes par bya ste/ thibs por gyur pa'i dbang po dang / sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / yongs su brtags pa'i dbang po dang / ngang gi rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang po dang / rgyu'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / rkyen gyi tshogs las byung ba'i dbang po dang / dbang po'i dran pa thams cad ma lus pa la mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing yongs su rig pa'i shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, setting aside this example, suppose there is someone who can in one instant know the differences in faculties of all sentient beings in countless worlds in the eastern direction, and continues in this way for an incalculable eon; then suppose there is a second person who could know in one instant all the differences in faculties known by the first person, in each instant of an incalculable eon; extend this to the tenth person and apply it also to the other nine directions—the limit of the various differences in faculties of the sentient beings of the worlds of the ten directions might be known, but no one can know the limit of the virtues of the enlightening being’s initial determination for unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just to know the faculties of sentient beings in a given limited number of worlds. It is to know all the various differences in faculties of all beings in all worlds, wanting to know the network of all faculties, that they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dbang po sna tshogs kyi dpe snga ma de dag lta zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes par gyur te/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs yongs su shes par gyur la/ tshul de lta bur sems bskyed pa re rer shes pas shar phyogs logs su bskal pa grangs med pa zad par byas kyang sems can gyi bsam pa sna tshogs kyi mthar phyin par ma rung la/ gzhung de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs ni/ shes par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mthar thug par mi rung ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de tsam dag gi bsam pa sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems mi skye'o/ / 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs yongs su shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes te/ gzhung de ltar mos pa la ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du ste/ bsam pa thibs por gyur pa dang / sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i bsam pa dang / yongs su gtogs pa'i bsam pa dang / ngang gis rjes su 'brang ba'i bsam pa dang / rgyu'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i bsam pa dang / rkyen gyi tshogs las byung ba'i bsam pa'i bar du bsam pa'i dra ba ma lus pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing yongs su rig pa'i shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again setting this example aside, suppose there is someone who can in a single instant know inclinations of all the sentient beings in countless worlds in the eastern direction, thus knowing more and more instant after instant for an incalculable eon. Extend this as before to ten people, and to all ten directions: the limit of the inclinations of these sentient beings of the ten directions might be known, but a limit to the virtues of the enlightening being’s first determination for unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment cannot be known by anyone. Why? Because the enlightening being’s determination for enlightenment is not limited to just the purpose of knowing the inclinations of a limited number of sentient beings. It is to know all the inclinations of all beings in all worlds, wanting to know the network of all inclinations, that they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bsam pa sna tshogs kyi dpe snga ma de dag lta zhog gi/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes te/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sbyor ba yongs su shes la/ gzhung de ltar mos pa la ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du ste/ phyogs bcu'i sbyor ba sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag ni/ mthar thug par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mthar thug par mi rung ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de tsam dag gi sbyor ba sna tshogs shes pa'i don du ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems mi skye'i/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sbyor ba sna tshogs yongs su shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / gzhung de ltar mos pa la ji skad du brjod pa bzhin te/ sbyor ba'i dra ba ma lus pa thams cad kyi bar du mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing yongs su rig pa'i shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, setting this example aside, suppose there is someone who can in a single instant know the techniques of all the sentient beings in countless lands in the eastern direction, and extend this example as before to ten people and to all ten directions: the extent of the various techniques of these sentient beings of the ten directions may be known, but the extent of the virtues of the enlightening being’s initial determination for enlightenment cannot be known by anyone. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just to know the various techniques of beings of a limited number of worlds. It is to know all the techniques of all beings of all worlds, wanting to know the network of all techniques, that they set their minds on unexcelled complete enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sbyor ba sna tshogs kyi dpe de dag lta zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes te /de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems bskyed pa sna tshogs rab tu shes la/ tshul de lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yongs su shes pas gzhung de bzhin du ste/ phyogs bcu'i sems bskyed pa sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni/ mthar thug par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mthar thug par mi rung ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de tsam dag gi sems sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba ma yin gyi; 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ sems can gyi khams kyis gtugs pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa'i sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sems sna tshogs thams cad yongs su shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / gzhung de ltar mos pa la ji skad du brjod pa bzhin te/ sems bskyed pa'i dra ba ma lus pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing yongs su rig pa'i shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, setting this example aside, suppose there is someone who can in a single instant know the various different mentalities of sentient beings in countless worlds in the eastern direction, and extend this example as before to ten people and to all ten directions: the bounds of the various different mentalities of the sentient beings in all these worlds of the ten directions may be known, but the bounds of the virtues of the enlightening being’s first determination for unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment cannot be known to anyone. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just to know the mentalities of a limited number of sentient beings; it is to know the various mentalities of the boundless sentient beings of the whole realm of space of the cosmos, wanting to completely know the network of all minds, that they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems bskyed pa'i dpe snga ma de dag lta zhog gi/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes par gyur te/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi las sna tshogs rab tu shes la/ sems bskyed pa shes pa'i tshul de lta bus shar phyogs logs su bskal pa grangs med pa zad par byas kyang sems can rnams kyi las sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mthar thug par mi rung la/ de bzhin du skyes bu bcu ba'i bar du skyes par gyur te/ skyes bu dgu po de dag gis sems can rnams kyi las sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa zad par byas pa de dag sems bskyed pa gcig gis shes par gyur kyang phyogs bcur las sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag ni/ mthar thug par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mthar thug par mi rung ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de tsam dag gi las sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba ma yin gyi/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dang / dus gsum ma lus pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi las sna tshogs yongs su shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ las sna tshogs mtha' dang dbus med pa la rab tu 'jug pa dang / las kyi bye brag thams cad la mkhas pa mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ sems can gcig grangs med cing rnam pa tha dad par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / las kyi tshul brjod pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa dang / las thams cad ma lus pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / las dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba rgya mtsho mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa tha dad pa la rab tu 'jug cing dus gsum thams cad kyi las sna tshogs kyi dbang gis yongs su shes par bya ba dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ skal pa mnyam pa'i las dang / skal pa mi mnyam pa'i las shes pa'i mchog thob par bya ba dang / las thams cad las gcig tu yang dag par 'jug pa dang / las gcig las thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ bla ma dang bcas pa'i las dang / bla na med pa'i las dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa'i las dang / mnyam pa'i las dang / mi mnyam pa'i las kyi bye brag ye shes kyi rgyud chen pos mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ gnas pa'i las dang / mi gnas pa'i las dang / thun mong gi las dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las dang / mtha' yas pa'i las dang / mu med pa'i las dang / ma 'dres pa'i las dang / dge ba'i las dang / mi dge ba'i las dang / 'jig rten pa'i las dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las dang / las kyi bye brag thams cad la ye shes kyi rgyud chen pos mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ shes pa'i las dang / mi shes pa'i las dang / chen po dang / 'bring dang / tshad med pa'i las kyi sgrib pa thams cad ma lus par chags pa med pas shes par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ rnam par dag pa'i las dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i las dang / rgya chen po'i las dang / rgya chung ngu'i las dang / kun tu 'brel ba'i las dang / kun tu ma 'brel ba'i las dang / phra ba'i las dang / sbom pa'i las dang / las ma lus par sems can gyi khams kyi las kyi tshul rnam pa tha dad pa la rab tu 'jug pa dang / sems can gcig gis las sna tshogs 'byams klas pa bcu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ thibs por gyur pa'i las dang / sbyor ba can gyi las dang / chung ba'i las dang / dran pa dang ldan pa'i las dang / rgyu'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i las dang / rkyen gyi tshogs las byung ba'i las dang / las kyi dra ba thams cad ma lus pa mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rig cing shes pas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, setting this example aside, suppose there is someone who can in a single instant know the various different actions of the sentient beings in countless worlds in the eastern direction; as before, extend this to the tenth person and to the ten directions: the bounds of the various different actions of these sentient beings of the ten directions may be known, but the bounds of the virtues of the enlightening being’s initial determination for unexcelled enlightenment cannot be known. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment only to know the actions of the sentient beings of a limited number of places. They want to know the actions of all sentient beings of past, present, and future, and want to know the network of all actions—this is why they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.
bam po nyi shu gsum pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ las sna tshogs kyi dpe snga ma de dag lta zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes te/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis shar phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems bskyed pa shes par gyur la/ tshul de ltar sems bskyed pa re re re yongs su shes pas shar phyogs logs su bskal pa grangs med pa zad par byas kyang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa sna tshogs mthar thug par ma rung la/ de bzhin du de'i 'og tu skyes bu gnyis pa zhig skyes zhes bya ba nas skyes bu bcu pa skyes pa'i bar du ste/ skyes bu dgu po de dag gis bskal pa grangs med par nyon mongs pa sna tshogs rab tu shes pa de dag sems bskyed pa gcig gis yongs su shes par gyur la/ tshul de 'dra bar sems bskyed pa re rer yongs su shes pas gzhung de bzhin du ste/ phyogs bcu'i nyon mongs pa sna tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag ni/ mthar thug par rung yang srid kyi/ byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ mthar thug par mi rung ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de tsam dag gi nyon mongs pa sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba ma yin gyi/ 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa tshad med pa thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ nyon mongs pa yang ba dang / nyon mongs pa lci ba mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i ye shes yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ bag la nyal ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sems can kun nas 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dgong pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ sems can gcig gi nyon mongs pa tshad med pa sna tshogs rang dbang med par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par gcad pa'i ye shes yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ ma rig pa la gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / sred pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / srid pa'i rgyud thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa kun tu sbyor ba rnam par gcod pa'i ye shes yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ 'dod chags kyis ye rngam pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / zhe sdang gis khong khro ba dang / gti mug gis mngon par khebs pa dang / cha mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rtsa ba dang bcas te rnam par gcod pa'i ye shes yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ bdag tu bya ba shin tu bsgoms pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdag gir bya ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / nga rgyal gyis bslang ba dang / nga rgyal gyis mngon par sprel ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par khong du chud cing yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i yongs su rtog pa rtsa bar gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / yongs su rtogs pa'i shugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jig tshogs la mngon par zhen pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi tshul sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i ye shes yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / 'di lta ste/ sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad shes pas rnam par dag par bya ba dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dra ba thams cad rnam par gcad pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skye'o/ /

“Again, leaving this example aside, suppose there is someone who can in one instant know the various afflictions of the sentient beings of countless worlds in the eastern direction, and thus knows more and more instant by instant for an entire incalculable eon; no one could know the bounds of the various differences of these afflictions. Now suppose there is a second person who can in one instant know all the differences in afflictions of sentient beings known by the first person in an incalculable eon, and also went on like this knowing more and more instant by instant for an incalculable eon. Again, extend this to the tenth person and the ten directions: the bounds of the differences of afflictions of these sentient beings of the ten directions may be known, but the limits of the virtues of the enlightening being’s initial determination on enlightenment cannot be known. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just to know the afflictions of sentient beings in a limited number of worlds; they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment to know all the differences in afflictions of all beings in all worlds. In other words, they want to thoroughly know light afflictions and heavy afflictions, afflictions of sleep and afflictions of waking, the various differences in the innumerable afflictions of each and every sentient being, and their various musings and ruminations, to clear away all their confusions and defilements; they want to thoroughly know all afflictions based on ignorance and afflictions connected with affection, to cut off all bonds of afflictions in all realms of being; they want to thoroughly know all afflictions of greed, all afflictions of hatred, all afflictions of folly, and all afflictions of greed, hatred, and folly in equal measure, to sever the root of all afflictions; they want to thoroughly know all afflictions of ego, afflictions of possessions, and afflictions of conceit, to be totally aware of all afflictions; they want to thoroughly know all basic and concomitant afflictions arising from misconceptions, and the sixty-two views arising from the idea of a real body existing, to vanquish all afflictions; they want to know thoroughly the afflictions of mental shrouds and hindrances; to develop a heart of great compassion to rescue and protect, to sunder the web of all afflictions and cause the nature of omniscience to be utterly pure—this is why they set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi dpe de dag lta'ang zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu la la zhig skyes par gyur la/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig pas shar phyogs logs su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa dag mnabs stsal bro ba'i mchog tshad med pa dang / bdug spos tshad med pa dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan tshad med pa dang / pho brang tshad med pa dang / bla re tshad med pa dang / gzhal med khang tshad med pa dang / rin po che'i dra ba dpag tu med pa dang / seng+ge'i gdan dpag tu med pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub tshad med pa dang / mchod pa'i rnam pa tshad med pas mnyes par byas te bskal pa tshad med par bsnyen bkur la/ rim gro dang / bkur sti byas te rje sa dang mchod pas btud cing phyag 'tshal te spyi bos gtugs nas snyan par brjod de 'khor zhing zhal du blta la/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re la yang mi de dang 'gro ba phal 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa de dag gis shin tu dad par mar me grangs med pa dag kyang bus te/ skyes bu des ji lta ba bzhin du sems can de dag gis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams de snyed po de dag nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba dang / yid bzhin gyi rgyal po dang / phyogs thams cad snang bar byed pa dang / me'i 'od dang / brgal dka' ba dang / chu'i zla ba'i 'od dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / bsod nams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / nor bu yid du 'ong ba dang / de dag la sogs pa rin po che tshad med pas yongs su bkang ste yon du gsol la/ de bzhin du me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / pho brang dang / gnam yol dang / sil snyan dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / glu dang / rin po che'i dra ba dang / gser gyi dra ba dang / nor bu'i dra ba dang / dril bu'i dra ba dang / seng+ge'i khri dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa brtsams pa rgya cher te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag bzhugs zhing 'tsho skyong ba'i tshe mchod pa'i rnam pa de lta bus mchod nas mya ngan las 'das nas kyang mi de dang / 'gro ba phal 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa de snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing yang mchod rten 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dang mnyam par yangs shing rgya che ba/ rin po che tshad med pa las brtsigs te/ rgyan dang / rin po che tshad med pas brgyan pa la/ mchod rten gcig ji lta ba bzhin du mchod rten dpag tu med pa mang po la yang de bzhin du byas te/ thams cad kyi tshad kyang de tsam la/ mchod rten re re la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs mang po tshad med par byas te 'jig rten gyi khams mang po yang snang bas rgyas par gyur la/ rnam grangs de lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro'i yon tan yongs su brjod pa de dag byed cing / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag la yang mchod pa bya bas bskal pa tshad med pa zad par gyur te/ shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs dang / phyogs bcu thams cad du yang rgya cher te/ skyes bu bcu sngon du 'gro bas phyogs bcu re re la skyes bu re re zhing yang phyogs bcur byas na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ skyes bu de la sogs pa'i mi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa bcur gtogs pa de dag la de'i rgyus bsod nams kyi phung po cher 'phel lam/ smras pa/

“Again, leaving this example aside, suppose there is someone who in the space of an instant presents countless Buddhas as well as sentient beings of innumerable worlds in the eastern direction with various fine foods and drinks, fragrant flowers and raiment, banners, pennants, canopies, parasols, sanctuaries with beautiful chambers, jeweled curtains and enclosures of nets, lion seats with various adornments, as well as all kinds of exquisite jewels, reverently honoring them, bowing to them and lauding them, humbly looking up to them, and continues thus unceasingly for countless eons, and also urges other sentient beings to make such offerings to the Buddhas, and after the Buddhas die sets up a monument for each one, the monuments high and wide, made of all kinds of precious substances from countless worlds, variously decorated, with countless statues of Buddhas in each monument, with radiance illuminating countless worlds, continuing this work for countless eons; and suppose the person did the same in the South, West, and North, the four intermediate directions, the zenith and the nadir: Do you think this person’s merit would be great?”
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis thugs su chud par zad do/ / smras pa/
The king of gods said, “Only a Buddha could know this person’s merit — no one else could assess it.”

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji tsam yod pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de la bskal pa tshad med par mnyes par byas pa'i sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / rim gro las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po snga ma des ni/ brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o; ; stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro/ grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ /

“Child of Buddha, this person’s merit, compared to the merit of the enlightening being’s initial determination for enlightenment, does not amount to a hundredth part, a thousandth, a hundred thousandth part, not even the smallest fraction.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dpe snga ma de dag lta'ang zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu gnyis pa zhig byung ste/ de'i sems bskyed pa gcig gis skyes bu snga ma de dang / 'gro ba phal 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa snga ma rnams kyis bskal pa tshad med par sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / rim gro mngon par 'du byas pa de dag sems bskyed pa gcig gis mngon par 'du byed la/ tshul de lta bur sems bskyed pa re rer mnyes par byed pas shar phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa mnyes par byas te/ gzhung de bzhin du thog ma la ji skad du brjod pa de bzhin du gnyis pa la dpag tu med pa/ gsum pa la grangs med pa/ bzhi pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ lnga pa la mtshungs pa med pa/ drug pa la kun tu mtha' yas pa/ bdun pa la mu med pa/ brgyad pa la sa mtshams med pa/ dgu pa la gzhal du med pa'i bar du ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ dpe snga ma de lta'ang zhog gi /kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la skyes bu bcu pa zhig skyes te/ skyes bu snga ma dgu po de dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med pa bcur gtogs pa'i sems can phal de dag gis bskal pa dpag tu med par sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / rim gros mnyes par byas pa de tsam du sems bskyed pa gcig gis mnyes par byed cing / tshul de ltar sems bskyed pa re rer mnyes par byed pas shar phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig pas zhal zas bro ba'i mchog brjod du med pa zhes bya ba nas gzhan yang rgya cher te/ de lta bus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das brjod du med pa mnyes par byas pa nas kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po la bskal pa brjod du med par gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po snga mas brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba nas rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba'i bar du ste/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas skyes pa de tsam nyi tshe zhig mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba'am/ sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa'i yo byad de tsam dag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems mi skye'i/ de ni/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ phyogs bcu tshad las 'das pa/ 'byams klas pa/ phyogs kyi rnam grangs mtha' yas pa'i dra bas khyab pa/ mig 'phrul gyi rnam pas bsam yas pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gzhi mnyam par chud pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus par 'dus pa'i tshul shin tu bstan pa/ 'du shes kyi rnam pa la gnas pa'i phyogs kyi dra ba rnam par phye ba la gnas pa thams cad du gtogs pa/ lhag ma med pa ma lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs dang tshul shin tu bstan pa dag tu sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa bgrangs pa'i tshul shin tu bstan par gtogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshul gyis mngon par thugs su chud pa dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed nub par gyur te/ yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gang yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang yang da ltar byung ba'i dus na da ltar phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes te/

“Again setting this example aside, suppose there is a second person who can in a single instant perform all the acts of almsgiving performed by the first person in countless worlds, to the beings therein, for countless eons; and suppose this person went on like this, instant after instant, presenting innumerable kinds of offerings to countless Buddhas as well as the sentient beings of innumerable worlds, for innumerable eons; and suppose that a third person, up to a tenth person, could each perform in an instant all the almsgiving performed by the preceding person, and did so instant after instant, presenting boundless, incomparably many, uncountable, unaccountably many, unthinkably many, immeasurably many, unspeakably many, unspeakably unspeakably many offerings to infinite, untold Buddhas as well as to all the sentient beings in as many worlds, for unspeakably unspeakably many eons, and then after the passing of each Buddha, built a monument for each one, high and wide, as previously described. This merit too would not amount to even the smallest fraction of the virtue of the enlightening being’s initial determination for enlightenment. Why? Because enlightening beings do not set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment just to make offerings to a certain number of Buddhas. They set their minds on unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment to make offerings to all the innumerable, unspeakably unspeakably many past, present, and future Buddhas of the entire space of the whole cosmos in all directions.

sems bskyed pa de skyes ma thag nas de dang der 'das pa'i grangs su gtogs pa dang / sngon gyi mur gyur pa ji snyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis mngon par thugs su chud pa de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yid ches so/ / de bzhin gshegs pa ma byon pa de dang / de'i dus su gtogs pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur bstan pa dpag tu med pa/ mtha' dang dbus med par shin tu bstan pa dpag tu med pa dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang byang chub sems dpa' de yid ches so/ / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa ma lus par mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang byang chub sems dpa' de yid ches shing yongs su 'dzin par byed/ yongs su rgyas par byed/ rab tu thob par byed/ khong du chud par byed/ rab tu reg par byed/ shin tu sgrub par byed/ rgyud gcig tu gyur par byed/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par byed do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar sems bskyed pa de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdung rgyud mi 'chad pa'i phyir skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can yongs su bsgral ba'i phyir skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'du ba dang / 'jig pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi srid pa gsum yongs su dag pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / bag chags thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi shi 'pho dang / skye ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po dang / sbyor ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi dus gsum gyi shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir skye ste/ sems bskyed pa des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dag dang nye bar 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang nye bar 'gyur ro/ / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu nye bar 'gro'o/ / ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu nye bar 'gro'o/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa rnams kyi chos kyang thob par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma byon pa rnams kyi chos kyang thob par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das da ltar byung ba rnams kyi chos kyang thob par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa rnams dang mnyam pa nyid du nye bar 'gro'o/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ba byon pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang mnyam pa nyid du nye bar 'gro'o/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i stobs la thub pa med pa yang shin tu brtan par 'gyur ro/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag gi mi bsnyengs pa yongs su dag pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa rnams kyi bstan par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyan mnyam pa nyid kyang rjes su 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi bstan par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyan mnyam pa nyid kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par shin tu bstan pa'i dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang rjes su 'thob bo/ /

“Having aroused this determination, they are able to know the first attainment of true awakening as well as the final release of all Buddhas of the past, are able to believe in the roots of goodness of all Buddhas of the future, and are able to know the knowledge and wisdom of all Buddhas of the present. The virtues of those Buddhas, these enlightening beings can believe in, can accept, can cultivate, can attain, can know, can witness, and can perfect; they can be equal, of the same nature, as the Buddhas. Why? Because these enlightening beings arouse their aspiration in order not to let the lineage of all enlightened ones die out; they arouse their aspiration in order to pervade all worlds; they arouse their determination in order to liberate the beings of all worlds; they arouse their aspiration in order to completely know the formation and disintegration of all worlds; they arouse their determination in order to completely know the defilement and purity of all beings; they arouse their minds in order to know the purity of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness in all worlds; they arouse their determination in order to completely know the inclinations, afflictions, and mental habits of all living beings; they arouse their aspiration in order to completely know the faculties and means of all beings; they arouse their determination in order to completely know the mental activities of all beings; they arouse their aspiration in order to know all beings’ knowledge of past, present, and future. Because they have set their minds on enlightenment, they are always remembered by all the Buddhas of past, present, and future, and will attain the unsurpassed enlightenment of all Buddhas of all times. Then they will be given the sublime teachings of all Buddhas of all times, and will be actually and essentially equal to all Buddhas of all times. Having cultivated the methods of fostering the Path used by all Buddhas of all times, consummated the powers and fearlessnesses of all Buddhas of all times, and adorned themselves with the unique qualities of all Buddhas of all times, they will thoroughly attain the knowledge and wisdom to explain the truth of all Buddhas of the cosmos. Why? Because by means of this determination they will attain Buddhahood.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ltar de ni/ sangs rgyas su shog cig ces bya ba'i sems bskyed pa des 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye ba yin/ ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye ba yin/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rnams dang mnyam pa yin/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang mnyam pa yin no/ /
ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang mnyam pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi spyod yul thams cad dang mnyam pa yin/ gcig tu nges pa'i lus gcig tu gyur pas kyang dus gsum du mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dang 'grogs pa yang thob pa ste/

“Know that such a person is thereupon the same as the Buddhas of all times, thereupon equal in perspective to the Buddhas of all times, thereupon equal in virtue to the Buddhas of all times, and attains the true knowledge of the ultimate equality of one body and infinite bodies of the Enlightened.

ye shes de dang 'grogs par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed par 'byung ba de skyes ma thag tu phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ched du brjod pa mdzad do/ /
sems bskyed pa de nyid rten du mdzad de 'dul ba ji bzhin du chos kyang yang dag par ston/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang 'dul ba tshad med pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang rab tu g.yo bar 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang snang bas rgyas par 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi ngan song yang rgyun chad par 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang yongs su dag par 'gyur/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang dag par ston par 'gyur/ sems can thams cad kyang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs thams cad kyang yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi snang ba thams cad kyang rab tu thob par 'gyur te/

“As soon as one sets the mind on complete enlightenment, one is praised by all the Buddhas of all quarters and can thereupon expound the teaching, edify and purify the beings of all worlds, and can thereupon shake all worlds, and can thereupon illumine all worlds, and can thereupon extinguish the pains of the states of misery in all worlds, and can thereupon beautify and purify all lands, and can thereupon manifest attainment of Buddhahood in all worlds, and can thereupon cause all living things to rejoice, and can thereupon enter into the essence of all reality realms, and can thereupon maintain the lineage of all enlightened ones, and can thereupon attain the light of wisdom of all Buddhas.

dus gsum du gtogs pa las sems bskyed pa der sangs rgyas sam/ sangs rgyas kyi chos sam/ byang chub sems dpa' 'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam/ rang sangs rgyas sam/ rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam/ nyan thos sam/ nyan thos kyi chos sam/ 'jig rten pa'am/ 'jig rten pa'i chos sam/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'am/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sam/ sems can nam/ sems kyi chos kyang rung ste/ ma 'dus pa gang yang med de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni/ ma gtogs so/ / de ltar na/ sems bskyed pa der ni/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'dus so/ /

“This enlightening being who has just aspired to enlightenment does not apprehend anything in the past, present, or future — whether Buddhas, Buddhas’ teachings, enlightening beings, principles of enlightening beings, solitary awakened ones, principles of solitary awakened ones, listeners, principles of listeners, the world, worldly things, the transmundane, transmundane things, sentient beings, or norms of sentient beings — the enlightening being only seeks omniscience and has no mental attachment to anything.”

de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe phyogs bcur 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rnam pa drug tu g.yos par gyur te/ g.yos so/ / rab tu g.yos so/ / kun tu g.yos so/ / 'gul to/ / rab tu 'gul to/ / kun tu 'gul to/ / ldeg go /rab tu ldeg go /kun tu ldeg go /chem chem/ rab tu chem chem/ kun tu chem chem mo/ / 'ur 'ur/ rab tu 'ur 'ur/ kun tu 'ur 'ur ro/ / shig shig / rab tu shig shig / kun tu shig shig go /de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sems bskyed pa de'i yon tan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos nyid rab tu thob pa'i phyir lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char yang mngon par bab bo; ; lha rdzas kyi spos kyi char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi phye ma'i char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi phreng ba'i char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi gos kyi char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi rgyan gyi char yang mngon par bab bo/ / lha rdzas kyi rol mo rnams kyang mngon par sgra 'byin par gyur to/ / lha rdzas kyi snang ba yang rab tu byung ngo/ / lha rdzas kyi 'od kyang rab tu byung ngo/ / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol nas de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi blo gros su mtshan btags pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis zhal mngon par bstan te gsung brjod pa/ chos kyi blo gros legs legs so/ / phyogs bcu na de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi chos bstan pa de la ched du brjod pa mdzad do; ; nged kyis kyang chos bstan pa 'di nyid shin tu rnam par phye ste/ nged kyis ji ltar shin tu rnam par phye ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang shin tu rnam par phye'o/ / 'di nyid du yang khyod kyi chos bstan pa des byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed do/ / de dag kyang nged kyis lung bstan te/ de dag ni/ ma 'ongs pa'i dus bskal pa stong phrag brjod du med pa'i mthar thams cad kyang dus gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams ming tha dad pa dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan gcig pa sha stag 'byung bar 'gyur te/ 'di ltar sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba sha stag tu 'gyur ro/ / nged kyis chos bstan pa 'di yang ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma thos pa rnams kyis thos par bya ba dang /

At that point, by the spiritual power of the Buddha, worlds as numerous as the atoms in ten thousand buddha-lands in each of the ten directions all quaked in six ways, rained celestial flowers, perfumes, incenses, garlands, robes, jewels, and ornaments, produced celestial music and radiated celestial lights and sounds. Now in each of the ten directions, beyond as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, were as many Buddhas as atoms in ten thousand buddha-lands, all named Truth Wisdom; each of them appeared bodily before the enlightening being Truth Wisdom and said these words: “Good, good! Truth Wisdom, you are now able to expound this teaching; we Buddhas, as many in each of the ten directions as atoms in ten thousand buddha-lands, also expound this teaching. All Buddhas teach in this way. As you expounded this teaching, there were as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten thousand buddha-lands who were inspired with the determination for enlightenment: we now give them all the prediction of enlightenment, that in the future, after ten unspeakable numbers of boundless eons, they will alike attain buddhahood in the same eon, and, appearing in the world, will all be called Pure Mind Buddha. The worlds they live in will each be different. We will all protect and keep this teaching, so that all the enlightening beings of the future who have not heard it will be able to hear it.”

ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir sems can rnams kyis shes shing / gling bzhi pa 'di'i ri rab kyi rtse mo la ji ltar sems can rnams 'dul bar gyur pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa/ grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ dpag tu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ brjod du med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa dag tu yang sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlab bo/ / thams cad na yang chos bstan pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba sha stag sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bstan pa dang / ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu gsal par bya ba dang / don gyis gdul ba'i snang ba thob pa dang / chos nyid rab tu 'thob par bya pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyud yang dag par bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mnyam pa nyid du bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings gnyis su med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rab tu ston to/ /

As in this world Endurance, atop the Mt. Sumerus of the four quarters, this teaching was spoken, to cause them to accept the teaching once they have heard it, so also was it spoken in all the countless worlds throughout the universe, to edify living beings. All those who expounded it were called Truth Wisdom. They spoke such a teaching by the spiritual power of the Buddhas, by the power of the Buddhas’ original vow, in order to reveal the Buddhas’ teaching, to illumine all with the light of knowledge, to expose the truth, to cause beings to realize the essence of things, to cause all congregations to rejoice, to reveal the causal basis of the Buddhas’ teaching, to realize the equality of all Buddhas, to comprehend the nonduality of the realm of reality.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros kyis phyogs bcur bltas te 'khor thams cad la rnam par bltas nas nam mkha'i khams rnams la ni/ rnam par dpyod/ sems can gyi khams ni/ yongs su smin par byed/ las dang rnam par smin pa'i khams ni/ 'gal bar mi byed/ nam mkha'i khams ni/ yongs su dag par byed/ kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba ni/ rab tu sel/ mos pa yangs pa las byung ba ni/ shin tu 'phel bar byed/ sems can gyi dbang po tha dad pa la ni/ rab tu 'jug / dus gsum ni/ mnyam par byed/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la ni/ yang dag par rtog cing / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs yongs su dag par bya ba la gzhol ba'i phyir de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then the enlightening being Truth Wisdom looked over all the congregations in all lands in the ten directions of the entire realm of space, and because he desired to perfect the living beings, because he wanted to purify all actions, results, and consequences, because he wanted to reveal the realm of reality, because he wanted to extirpate the roots of defilement, because he wanted to increase great faith and resolution, because he wanted to cause all to know the faculties of infinite sentient beings, because he wanted to cause all to know the equality of past, present, and future phenomena, because he wanted to cause all to contemplate the realm of nirvana, and because he wanted to increase inherently pure roots of goodness, he spoke these verses by the power of Buddha:

gang zhig phyogs rnams bcu po ma lus rgyas byas shing / / sems can zhing dang chos gsum dag kyang rtogs gyur pa/ / sangs rgyas mtsho mchog byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin te/ / de dag 'jig rten phan phyir sems kyi dam pa bskyed/ /
nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa'i chos dbyings ji bzhin dang / / ji ltar sangs rgyas chos rnams 'gro kun rjes song dang / / sangs rgyas thams cad kun tu khyab brnyes ji bzhin gyi/ / 'gro ba mi ldog don du phan par rab tu zhugs/ /
'jig rten rnams la byams pas rtag par rab gnas shing / / 'tshe ba med pa 'gro la phan phyir su zhugs te/ / snang ba mi zad 'od byed gnas su gyur pa rnams/ / bsam gyis mi khyab stobs bcu mnga' bas byin gyis brlabs/ /
de ni zhing rnams tha dad ma yin tshul yang rnyed/ / de ni lus kyi rnam pa kun la rab tu zhugs/ / bsod nams ye shes de yang sangs rgyas byang chub bzhin/ / 'di ni chags med gzhol ba ye shes rgyur skyes so/ /

To benefit the world enlightening beings make a great resolution, That resolution extending everywhere throughout the ten directions: Living beings, lands, the phenomena of past, present, and future, Enlightened as well as enlightening beings, supreme oceans,
To the limits of space, equal to the cosmos, And all the worlds there are therein: In accord with Buddhas’ teachings, they go to every one; Arousing their minds this way, they never regress.
They think of living beings with compassion, never abandoning them; They reject all that is harmful, benefiting all. Their light illumines the world, being as a refuge, Guarded by the Ten Powered inconceivably.
They enter all lands in the ten directions, Manifesting all kinds of physical forms. In accord with Buddhas’ virtue and knowledge, boundless, They cultivate the appropriate causes, without any attachment.

spyi'u tshugs rgyu ba'i 'gro ba sna tshogs ma lus par/ / gzhan yang zhing rnams 'byams klas chags med mthar thug pa/ / de dag phra sbom rgya che yangs pa thams cad du; ; byang chub sems mchog de ni gcig pu kun tu 'gro /
brjod du med pa shin tu phra zhing mi gnas pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mchog la rtag zhugs shing / / mkhas pa gang gis sangs rgyas chos mthong mi ngoms pa/ / de dag chos rnams rgya mtsho'i rnam par chud pa yin/ /
'jig rten lam rgyud kun la su zhig snying brtse zhing / / 'jig rten gsum po sbyang par rtag tu zhugs pa rnams/ / phyi ma'i mthar thug sangs rgyas gdung gi rgyun mi gcod/ / de ni bdud kyi khyim yang rab tu 'joms pa yin/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba rnams dang rgyud gcig dngos gyur cing / / shin tu phra ba'i tshul gyis lam la rtag brtson te/ / su zhig sangs rgyas yul la dad sems pa/ / de ni chags med thub pa kun gyis dbang yang bskur/ /
rdo rje lta bur sra zhing brtan la mi shigs pa/ / rkang gnyis gtso bos mdzad pa rtag tu dran shes shing / / 'dren pa'i spyod yul snang rab shin tu rnyed pa rnams; ; gzhan gyi dring la mi rgyug byang chub sems kyang skye/ /

Some lands face upward, some sideways or inverted; Coarse, subtle, wide and vast—there are innumerable kinds: Once enlightening beings have roused the supreme aspiration, They can travel to all of them, unobstructed.
Enlightening beings’ supreme practices cannot be all told: All they cultivate diligently without dwelling anywhere. Seeing all Buddhas, they’re always joyful, And enter everywhere into the ocean of profound truths.
Pitying beings living in mundane dispositions, They cause them to clear away defilements, to be thoroughly pure; Succeeding to the lineage of Buddhas, they do not let it die out: They devastate the palace of demons, completely destroying them.
Dwelling in the equanimity of the Enlightened, They skillfully cultivate subtle techniques. Developing aspiration for the realm of buddhahood, They are anointed by the Buddhas, their minds without attachment.
Remembering to requite their debt to the Most Honorable Human, Their minds are incorruptible, like diamond. Able to clearly comprehend the sphere of Buddhas’ action, They naturally cultivate and practice enlightening deeds.

'gro ba rnams kyi 'du shes rnam pa mang shes shing / / de bzhin las dang 'bras bu sems kyi rnams kyang ste/ / gzhan yang dbang po'i mthu dang khams rnams dus ma dag / kun kyang byang chub sems dpa' spyod yul gcig yin no/ /
gang zhig chos kyi dbyings bzhin byang chub sems yangs shing / / rtag tu chos la mi gnas nam mkha' ji bzhin pa/ / chags med sems ldan de dag sangs rgyas ye shes zhugs/ / de dag rtogs med chos can yang dag mtha' la gnas; ;
sems can bsam pa rnam 'byed sems can 'du shes med/ / chos kyi rnam rtog khrag khrig pha mthar rab tu phyin/ / de dag rtog la mos shing rnam par mi rtog ste/ / de dag zhing rnams bye ba khrag khrig rjes su zhugs/ /
gang zhig sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig rjes sems shing / / gang zhig chos dbyings tshul gyi mdzod du zhugs gyur la/ / gang zhig sems can dbang po'i rnam pa'i mthar phyin pa/ / de dag sems can gtso bzhin chos nyid shes pa yin/ /
lhag pa'i bsam pa dag dang rtag par mngon ldan zhing / / skyes bu'i seng+ge'i bsnyen bkur phyir ldog mi 'gyur la/ / 'jig rten gtso bo mkhas pa mthong bas mi ngoms pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas khrag khrig bye bas byin gyis brlabs/ /
zab mo'i chos rnams rnam par 'byed kyang chags pa med/ / gnas pa med pas sems kyi dam pa rtag tu dag / de dag bskal pa mtha' yas skyes bu seng+ge'i sems/ / dus gsum chags pa med par rtogs pa'i yid dang ldan/ /
mi 'phrog thub par mi nus yid kyi dbang po dang / / gsum pa rjes su song dang rtag tu ldan gyur cing / / chos rnams 'byams klas shin tu bslab pas rmongs med pa/ / de dag chos dbyings 'gengs kyang nam yang mi ngoms so/ /
tshig gi lam 'das ji bzhin mkhas pa zhi ba shes/ / de bzhin nyid la nam yang rnam par mi 'byed pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas thams cad yul la rjes sems shing / / dus gsum chags pa med pa rtogs pa'i yid ldan 'gyur/ /
mkhas pa gang zhig sems bskyed 'byams klas chos kyi dbyings/ / 'gengs shing phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing du 'gro ba ni/ / de dag khrag khrig tshul rnams brjod du med pa yi/ / snang ba rnyed par gnas pa'i rgyal ba'i sras yin no/ /

The different thoughts of the various realms of beings are infinite— Their acts, their results, and their minds are also not one— Everything down to their various different faculties and natures Are all clearly seen once the great mind is developed.
That mind is far-reaching, as vast as the cosmos; Without reliance, unchanging, like space— Heading for Buddha-knowledge without grasping anything, It clearly comprehends the realm of truth, apart from discriminatory thought.
Knowing the minds of living beings without the concept of beings, Comprehending all things without the concept of things, Though discriminating all, yet free from discrimination, It goes to all lands, billions and trillions.
Following, contemplating, able to enter all The wondrous troves of teachings of countless Buddhas, Knowing all the faculties and behaviors of living beings, Those who have reached this point are like the Buddha.
Always in accord with the pure great vow, Gladly supporting the enlightened without turning back, Always pleasing to the sight of humans and celestials, Always protected mindfully by the Buddhas,
Their minds are pure, free from dependence; Though they contemplate the profound teaching, they do not cling, Meditating thus for countless eons Without any attachments in the past, present, or future.
Their minds are firm and sure, impossible to overcome; They proceed to Buddhas’ enlightenment without obstruction. Determined to seek the wondrous Way, they get rid of infantile ignorance; Traversing the whole cosmos, they do not complain of weariness.
They know the phenomena of speech and language are all null and void; Only entering into true thusness, they cut off different interpretations. Harmoniously observing all the spheres of the enlightened, They comprehend all frames of time, their minds without obstruction.
When enlightening beings first develop the vastly great mind, They can go to all lands in the ten directions: Aspects of truth beyond number or explanation Their light of knowledge illumines clearly.

chos rab mu stegs snying rje'i tshul gyi rjes song zhing / / byams pa'i pha rol phyin pa bar snang ji bzhin te/ / sems can khams la nam yang yongs su rtog med pa/ / de dag rnam rtog med la brtson zhing 'jig rten spyod/ /
phyogs bcu dag tu bden pas 'gro ba yid 'bebs par/ / dong bas sems can gtso bo de dag kun tu rgyu/ / bden pa'i tshig brtson rtag tu nges pa'i sems ldan pa/ / de dag phyogs bcu'i mi yi mchog gis byin gyis brlabs/ /
'das par gyur pa'i dus kyang de dag rjes su dran/ / de bzhin ma 'ongs dus la 'jug pa rnam par sgom/ / de dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun na mi gnas te/ / sems can phan dang dgrol phyir kun tu rnam par rgyu/ /
ye shes 'od mchog dam pas chags pa med gyur la/ / rgyu yi rnam pa chos rab nem nur med brtan rnams/ / de dag the tshom thams cad rnam par zlog pa byed/ / chos kyi dbyings 'dir nem nur med par rab tu 'jug /
gang zhig bdud rnams kun gyi gnas rnams 'joms byed dang / / gang yang sems can rab rib shin tu sel byed dang / / gang rnams rtog pa 'jig cing rnam rtog mi 'grogs pa/ / sems can gtso bo de dag yul la the tshom med/ /
dus gsum ma lus the tshom rnam par bzlog byas shing / / bsam pa'i mchog gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung 'gro ste/ / dad pa'i stobs dang ldan zhing blo brtan rnyed pa rnams/ / de dag don rtogs khong du chud cing blo yang dag /
mkhas pa 'gro ba'i don du phyi ma'i mthar spro ste/ / sems can don du rnam thar 'byams klas yongs su 'tshol/ / yun ring dus su skyo ba med cing zhum pa med/ / sems can dmyal ba sdug bsngal mang po zlog par byed/ /
de dag bsod nams mi zad ye shes ldan/ / 'gro ba'i dbang po sna tshogs bsam la rab tu 'jug / skye rgu'i las kyi rgyud kyang shin tu shes byas shing / / bsam pa ji bzhin tshul 'dra'i chos rnams mtha' yas brjod/ /
'gro la byams pa'i sa rnams kun dang rjes su ldan/ / bdag med nyid rtogs 'on kyang btang snyoms byed pa min/ / de dag snying brtse gcig tu gsal bar chos kyang brjod/ / 'on kyang dmigs par mi gnas de dag 'jig rten rgyu/ /
de dag 'od zer dra ba sna tshogs mdog bkye zhing / / 'gro ba'i mun pa bsal te kun tu snang byas nas/ / 'od zer sgo yi pad+mo dag la rgyal sras rnams/ / kun tu bstan de rdul dang bral ba'i chos kyang ston/ /

Liberating many with great compassion, utterly beyond compare, Their kindness extends everywhere, like space. And yet they do not discriminate in regard to living beings; Thus being pure, they roam through the world.
Giving solace and comfort to living beings everywhere, Everything they do is true and genuine. Always with a pure heart, they don’t contradict themselves; They are always strengthened and protected by all the Buddhas.
They remember everything that was in the past, And discern everything in the future. They enter all worlds in the ten directions To liberate beings, causing them to be detached.
Enlightening beings have the light of sublime knowledge And understand causes and conditions beyond any doubt. They do away with all confusion and delusion, And in this way roam the reality-realm.
All the palaces of demons they smash; All the blinders of living beings they destroy. Free from discrimination, minds undisturbed, They understand well the realm of the enlightened.
They have removed the webs of doubt of all time And aroused faith in those who have realized thusness. By faith they’ve attained immutable knowledge, And because their knowledge is pure their understanding is true.
In order to allow living beings to attain emancipation, And to benefit them universally throughout all time, They undergo long toils and hardships unflagging, Calmly enduring even the pains of the hells.
Replete with boundless virtue and wisdom, They know all the faculties and inclinations of beings; They see all, including their works and deeds, And teach them in accord with their tendencies.
They understand all is empty and selfless, Yet think kindly of beings, never abandoning them; With one subtle, sublime voice of great compassion They enter all worlds to teach.
Emanating great lights of various colors, They shine on all beings, removing the darkness; In the lights are enlightening beings sitting on lotus blossoms Bringing forth the pure teaching for all beings.

spu gcig rtse la zhing rnams rgyal bas brgyan pa dang / / de bzhin rgyal ba'i sras kyis brgyan pa mngon par mthong / / 'khor rnams blo sems gzhan dang gzhan can dpe med pa/ / 'gro ba de dag sems shes rmongs med ston pa byed/ /
sems 'jug gcig gis phyogs rnams bcu po thams cad kyi/ / brjod du med pa khrag khrig zhing rnams kun bgrod cing / / song ste sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i don du mchod byas nas/ / dri ba khrag khrig don dang ldan pa sna tshogs 'dri/ /
bde gshegs rnams la pha yi 'du shes nyer bzhag cing / / chos kyi gter mkhas rtag tu shes rab rnon po can/ / ye shes 'byung gnas mkhas pas sangs rgyas chags med phyir/ / 'gro ba'i don 'dod byang chub mchog gi spyod pa sgrub/ /
gang rnams chos dbyings rnam par phye zhing bsam byas kyang / / bskal pa mang po 'das byas zad par ma gyur te/ / chos nyid gnas med gang la'ang chud par ma gyur kyang / / chags med ye shes can rnams skyo sems med par spyod/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba'i rigs su rigs dang ldan gyur cing / / bde gshegs kun gyi sku las yang dag byung gyur pas/ / chos kyi lus can de dag 'gro la gzugs lus ston/ / sgyu mkhan mkhas pa yid 'ong sgyu ma ston pa bzhin; ;
mkhas pa de dag la lar spyod pa mchog rnyed snang / / la lar mkhas pa skye zhing mya ngan 'das par snang / / byang chub dam pa'i mchog kyang rnam par 'tshang rgya snang / / mya ngan 'da' ba ston pa'ang de bzhin la lar snang / /
rang rgyal rnams dang nyan thos rgyal ba'i sa min pa'i/ / chos nyid de la ji ltar rab tu gnas pa ltos/ / lus dang sgra med bsam med 'du shes ldan pa min/ / 'on kyang bya ba sna tshogs du ma nye bar ston/ /
'gro bar chos rnams rnam par 'byed cing skyer 'gyur te; ; 'jig rten gtso bo mi bzhugs phyi na rgyal sras rnams/ / chags med mthar phyin pa yi ye shes mi gnas te/ / sangs rgyas byin brlabs rnam par 'phrul pa dag kyang ston; ;
'jig rten 'di na de dag 'dra ba gang yang med/ / de dag pas kyang 'phags pa lta ko ci zhig smos/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yangs pa ma thob par/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs su rnam 'phrul mchog kyang thob/ /
gang rnams chos rab 'phags par rtag tu 'jug byed pa/ / de dag chos rab dam pa mchog gi theg pa yin/ / 'jig rten dus dang dus min tshod kyang shes byas shing / / de dag 'gro la phan phyir rnam par 'phrul pa ston/ /
dpa' bo gang rnams zhing kun bdag gi lus 'gengs shing / / gang rnams 'jig rten 'od zer dra ba mchog gtong ba/ / mun pa bsal cing snang bas 'jig rten rgyas par byed/ / klu yi dbang po bzhin du chos kyi char pa 'bebs/ /

In a single pore they manifest many lands, With great enlightening beings filling them all. The knowledge of the congregation is different for each, While all can understand the minds of living beings.
To unspeakably many lands in the ten directions They can go in an instant, to all of them, Aiding beings, giving offerings to Buddhas. From the Buddhas they ask the profound truth;
They think of the enlightened ones as parents, And perform enlightening practices to benefit sentient beings. With wisdom and flexible means they penetrate the treasury of truths, Entering the profound realm of knowledge without any attachment.
Meditating in accord with truth, they explain the reality-realm For countless eons, without being able to exhaust it. Though their knowledge skillfully penetrates, it has no location; They are not tired or wearied, have no attachment to anything.
Born in the house of the Buddhas of past, present, and future, They experience the subtle reality-body of the enlightened ones. Manifesting various forms for all living beings, Like magicans there’s nothing they can’t make:
Some manifest the beginning of practice of excellent action, Some manifest birth, up to leaving home, Some manifest fulfilling enlightenment under a tree, And some show extinction, for the benefit of beings.
The rare truth in which enlightening beings abide Is only the realm of Buddhas, not the two vehicles. They are rid of concepts of body, speech, and thought, But can manifest them variously, according to the occasion.
The Buddha-teachings attained by enlightening beings Sentient beings go crazy when thinking of. The knowledge of enlightening beings enters reality, their minds unhindered; Everywhere they manifest the independent powers of the Enlightened;
In this they have no compare in all the world: How much the more when their excellent practices are added. Though they have not yet completely fulfilled omniscience, They have already attained the independent power of the enlightened.
Already they abide on the ultimate path of the One Vehicle And enter deeply into the subtle highest truth. They know beings well, and appropriate and inappropriate times; For beings’ benefit they reveal spiritual powers:
Multiplying their bodies, they fill all lands, Emanating pure light to remove the darkness of the world. Like dragon kings producing great clouds, They shower wonderful rains, filling and refreshing all.

rmi lam lta bu log pa'i sgyu ma 'dra ba yi/ / 'du byed rab tu shes nas las rnams sbyor 'jug cing / / 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos khyab byas nas/ / rang bzhin dag pas thar lam bya ba med pa ston; ;
gang rnams rgyal ba'i stobs rnams ji bzhin tshad med dang / / gang rnams mkha' ltar 'gro ba kun tu mtha' yas shing / / gang rnams sems can khams kun yongs su dgrol brtson pa/ / de dag bskal pa bye ba grangs med spyad pa spyod/ /
las mchog bla na med pa shin tu sbyangs pa yis/ / yon tan dam pa sna tshogs rnams kyang kun sems shing / / byang chub sems dpa' de dag spyod pa mchog mi mthong / / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba rnam par lta/ /
sems 'byung gcig gis 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ / 'byams klas kun tu rgyu zhing 'gro ba rab tu snang / / rtog dang rnam rtog mi byed dag pa'i sems dang ldan/ / de dag gcig min lus la lus gcig ston pa byed/ /
de dag 'jig rten kun la rtog par mi byed de/ / mgon po kun gyi chos nyid yongs su mi rtog go / de dag chos kun rnam 'byed 'dod chags bral gyur kyang / / 'gro ba thar par bya ba yongs su mi gtong ngo/ /
'jig rten kun gyi 'du shes rnam pa gang yod pa/ / bzang ngan 'bring dang de bzhin chung dang sna tshogs kyis/ / 'du shes thibs po dag dang rab brgal rnam phye ste/ / de dag byin brlabs rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu ston/ /
ji ltar sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med pa/ / de 'dra'i rnam par 'phrul bas chos dbyings 'di dag 'gengs/ / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas klas lus kyi bye brag gis/ / 'gro ba rnams kyi mos pa ji bzhin ston par byed/ /
de dag gang la'ang ma chags rtog dang rnam rtog med/ / dogs pa med cing nyon mongs de bzhin rlom sems med/ / de dag sangs rgyas chags pa'i blo med thar la min/ / 'gro ba kun la'ang bde ba'i 'du shes rab tu skyed/ /
'jig rten kun na shes la mkhas rab mi 'jigs pa/ / 'jig rten 'du shes gnas la 'jug par mi byed de/ / de dag chos kun 'di la 'du shes gang zhes rtog / de ltar gzhigs na dus gsum gang yang dmigs pa med/ /
sngon gyi mthar thug 'das pa'i dus la rab zhugs te/ / phyi ma'i mthar thug ma 'ongs pa la rab zhugs nas/ / zhing rnams kun na ci yod kun kyang de bzhin du/ / shin tu shes kyang rtag par gang yang mi dmigs so/ /
mya ngan 'das pa'i dbyings la'ang brtson par de bzhin gnas/ / nyon mongs med pa'i tshul gyi rjes song mi gnas te/ / de dag yang dag mtha' 'dra de la 'dra ba med/ / byang chub spyod pa las kyang dpa' bo mi ldog go /

They see sentient beings as like illusions and dreams, Always revolving in circles from the force of their acts; With compassion and pity they rescue them all, Explaning to them the uncreated, pure nature of things.
The infinity of Buddhas’ powers is also like this: Like space, it has no bounds. In order to enable sentient beings to attain liberation, They diligently practice for eons untiring.
Pondering in various ways upon wondrous virtues, They skillfully cultivate the unsurpassed foremost of works; Never giving up the transcendent practices, They concentrate on developing omniscience.
With one body they manifest innumerable bodies, Omnipresent throughout all worlds, Their minds pure, with no discrimination; Such is their instantaneous inconceivable power.
They do not discriminate among worlds, They have no illusions about any thing; While they contemplate the teachings, they do not grasp them, And though they are always rescuing beings none are delivered.
All worlds are only mental images: Therein are various distinctions: Knowing the realms of ideation are dangerous and deep, Enlightening beings manifest spiritual powers to rescue and liberate.
Like the powers of a magician Are the spiritual metamorphoses of enlightening beings; Their bodies fill the cosmos and space For all to see according to their mentalities.
Both distinctions of subject and object they have left behind: Whether defiled or pure, nothing do they grasp; Cognition of bondage or of liberation they entirely forget, Only vowing to grant bliss to all sentient beings.
All worlds being only the force of ideation, They enter them by knowledge with minds free from fear. Their contemplation of all things is also thus: Investigating their past, present, and future, they cannot be apprehended.
Able to enter into the whole of the past, Able to enter into the whole of the future, Able to enter into all places in the present, They always observe diligently how nothing exists.
According with the dispassionate state of nirvana, They abide in noncontention and nonreliance. Their minds, like ultimate reality, have no compare: They are turned wholly to enlightenment, never to regress.

gang rnams byang chub brtan pa ri rab bzhin gnas shing / / sangs rgyas rgyal sras mkhas pas chos dbyings thams cad dang / / 'gro ba kun tu shin tu gang byas pa/ / 'di ni dpa' bo rnams kyi spyod pa'i mchog yin no/ /
blo mchog dam pa gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa yi/ / rnam grol mdzes pa'i tshul mchog yangs pa 'dod pa ni/ / des ni gang las zag zad srid gsum bde 'byung ba'i/ / byang chub sems la rim pa med par 'jug par gyis/ /
gang gi bsam pa rdul bral byang chub sems gnas pa/ / de dag yon tan legs pa zad par brjod pi nus/ / yon kyang 'gro ba'i don du bde gshegs legs brjod phyir/ / yon tan ldan pa de yi spyod pa mchog kyang nyon/ /
