gang gis zhing rnams bye ba khrag khrig rdul byas te/ / phyogs rnams re re kun tu bkang ste bgrang byas shing / / de yi rjes su dpag pas rnam 'dren zad byed na/ / 'du shes rnams ni mthar thug zad par mi 'gyur ro/ /
gang zhig sems can grangs mkhas sems can 'du shes med/ / spyod pa tsam du gzhol zhing sgra la ma chags par/ / gang zhig 'jig rten khams 'byeng chags pa med pa'i sems/ / de dag ldan dang grangs mkhas grangs dmigs med pa yin/ /
yid kyis nam mkha'i dbyings ni mtha' yas rgya che dang / / dus rnams 'jig rten kun tu rtogs pa'i mkhas pa gang / / sbar mos thal gtor bzhin du the tshom rnams gtor ba/ / de dag sangs rgyas chos rtogs yid can chags pa med/ /
gang dag phyogs rnams mtha' yas zhing la rab 'jug cing / / sems bskyed gcig gis blo nyams med par 'dod byed pa/ / de dag tha dad grangs la rtog pas der zhugs te/ / skye ba med pa'i chos la yang dag mtha' ltar mkhas/ /
gang zhig sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig bsam yas pa'i/ / 'khor du nye bar phyin te zham ring 'khor gnas shing / / gtso bo dag la 'dri ba'i thog mar gang 'gro ba; ; spyod yul mchog can de yi smon lam mchog 'di yin/ /
gang zhig phyogs rnams kun gyi mgon po kun dran zhing / / chos nyid de la nam yang gnas par ma gyur pa/ / khams gsum dge ba gang yod kun gyi rgyu yin te/ / de dag zhing rnams thams cad yongs su dag par sbyong / /
gang rnams skye ba'i rgyud du srid gsum sna tshogs rnams/ / 'jig rten kun na yod la ma chags mig gyur pa/ / de dag bag chags mkhas shing de bzhin dbang po mkhas/ / mos pa bye ba khrag khrig bsam yas de bzhin mkhas/ /

Cultivating supreme practice without backsliding or weakening, They rest on enlightenment, unwavering. Buddhas, enlightening beings, and the worlds Throughout the cosmos, they all clearly understand.
If you want to attain the supreme, foremost of paths, And be an omniscient sovereign of liberty, You should quickly develop the determination for enlightenment, Forever end indulgence and help sentient beings;
Proceeding to enlightenment, mind pure, Your virtues will be vast and great beyond telling. I am setting this forth for the benefit of beings: Those of intelligence should listen well.
Infinite worlds are all atoms: In each atom are infinite lands; The Buddhas in each are infinite: Enlightening beings see all clearly without any grasping;
They know living beings without having such a concept, They know spoken words with no idea of speech. Their minds are unhindered in any world: They comprehend all without attachments.
Their minds are broad and vast as space, They comprehend all things in all times. They annihilate all doubt and confusion, And correctly perceive the Buddhas’ teachings without clinging.
To infinite lands in the ten directions They instantly go, their minds without attachment. Understanding the reasons for suffering in the world, They all dwell in the uncreated sphere of reality.
To the assemblies of infinite Buddhas They go to call on them; Always being leaders, they ask the Buddhas About the vows and practices cultivated by enlightening beings.
Their minds always remember the Buddhas of the ten directions, Yet without depending on or grasping anything. They constantly urge living beings to plant roots of goodness, Adorning their lands, making them pure.
All sentient beings in all realms of existence They observe with unobstructed eyes: Their habits, natures, faculties, and understandings, Countless and boundless, all they clearly see.

'gro ba'i bsam pa ji bzhin gang gis shes gyur cing / / shes rab chen po de dag de bzhin chos ston pa/ / de dag kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag tshul la mkhas/ / sems can mang po rnam par sbyong ba'i lam ldan ston/ /
gang zhig ting 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig brjod yas rnams/ / sems kyi rgyu ba gcig gi rjes su zhugs gyur pa/ / de dag mtshan ma sna tshogs gnas par rab tu shes/ / ldang ba'i rgyu la mkhas shing blo gros spyod yul shes/ /
chags med byang chub de la mngon du gang zhugs shing / / 'gro la phan pa'i don du blo yangs su zhugs pa/ / ye shes 'byams klas 'di dang de dag ldan pa yin/ / de phyir de dag skyes bu mchog gi gsung yang sgrog /
gang zhig bskal pa ring dang bskal pa thung mkhas shing / / nyin zhag mkhas shing de bzhin zla ba zla phyed mkhas/ / gang yang 'jig rten rtag tu skye ba mkhas gyur pa/ / zhing gi rnam pa mkhas shing rnam phye'i chos med pa'o/ /
gang rnams phyogs la zhugs te phyogs kyi rjes 'brang zhing / / phyogs kun tshad ni rjes su shes par ma gyur pa/ / de dag dbus mas phyogs kyi rjes su 'gro byed cing / / zhing rnams sbyong yang yongs su dag rtogs chags pa med/ /
stobs la 'jug pas rgyal ba rnams kyi stobs shes pa/ / 'gro ba rnams kyi gnas dang gnas min bsam byas nas/ / 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar byung ba'i las kyi sa/ / yang dag rtogs byas las kyi rnam par smin la gnas/ /
'jig rten kun mkhas sna tshogs tha dad ji bzhin du/ / srid gsum rnam par rgyu ba'i tshul yang ji bzhin dang / / dbang po rnon po 'bring dang dbang po tha mar yang / / 'gro ba ma lus kun gyi dbang po rnam par 'byed/ /
mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs dge dang mi dge dang / / bzang ngan de bzhin 'bring la rnam par sems byed cing / / 'gro ba kun na 'gro ba brtan pa rnam par 'byed/ / srid gsum rgyu yi rgyud kyang de dag rab tu shes/ /
bsam gtan rnam thar nyon mongs ji bzhin mtshan ma mthong / / nyon mongs mtshams sbyor rnam byang ci 'gyur dang / / sngon chad gnas kyi bde dang sdug bsngal rgyud rnams kyang / / brtan pa rnams ni sangs rgyas stobs rnams sbyong bar byed/ /
ji ltar 'gro ba'i lam rgyud nyon mongs las 'jug dang / / 'gro rgyud thams cad 'jig cing zhig 'gyur thams cad dang / / zag pa sna tshogs rnams kyang ji ltar skye 'gyur ba/ / bag chags mtshams sbyar ji bzhin de bzhin rab tu 'jug /
ji ltar 'jig rten nyon mongs zad cing dag gyur pa/ / de la skyes bu khyu mchog spyod pa'i blo dang ldan/ / stobs 'chang dag ni stobs bcu rnams kyi 'od snang ste/ / rgyal ba'i stobs kyang thob min the tshom yod pa min/ /

Aware of all defilement and purity, They cause them to cultivate themselves and enter the Way. Measureless, countless meditation concentrations Enlightening beings can enter in a single instant:
Their perceptions, knowledges and objects therein They all know thoroughly and attain mastery. Enlightening beings, attaining this great knowledge, Immediately direct it to enlightenment, unhindered.
Because they want to help and benefit living beings, Wherever they are they expound the principles of great people. They know the long and short eons of the worlds, A month, a fortnight, a day and a night,
In each land are different, but equal in essence. Always diligently observing, they are not lax or indulgent; Going to all worlds in the ten directions, Yet they do not cling to place or location;
Adorning and purifying all lands with exception, Yet they never produce the concept of purity. Sentient beings’ rights and wrongs, The differences in their deeds and the consequences,
They accordingly reflect upon, entering the Buddha’s power And comprehending all of this. The various natures in all worlds, Various courses of action, and their realms of being,
Sharp faculties as well as the middling and inferior— All such things do they observe and examine. Various understandings, pure and impure, Superior, inferior, and middling, all they clearly see.
The acts of all beings and where they lead, The continuity of realms of being—all they can explain. Meditations, concentrations, liberations, trances, Defiled and pure, their causes and origins each different:
These, plus the differences of pain and pleasure of past lives, Purely cultivating Buddha-power, all they can see. Sentient beings’ habitual delusions continue the various states of being— By cutting off these tendencies and states they attain peace and dispassion,
Various tainted states do not arise anymore: All this, and the seeds of those habits, enlightening beings know. The afflictions of the Enlightened are all extinguished: Their light of great knowledge illumines the world.
Though enlightening beings have not yet attained Buddhas’ ten powers, yet they do not have doubt.

Enlightening beings, in a single pore, Manifest the infinite lands of the ten directions: Some are defiled, some are pure, Made by various deeds—all do they comprehend.
In a single atom, infinite lands, With infinite Buddhas and their offspring; The lands are each distinct, not mixed up: As of one, all they clearly see.
In one pore they see all the worlds In the space of the ten directions. There is not a single place where there is no Buddha; Thus are the buddha-lands all pure.
bam po nyi shu bzhi pa/

de ltar brtan pas rgyal bas stong min zhing shes nas/ / 'jig rten kun kyang spu rtse gcig la yod par 'jug / dus gsum rgyud rnams mtshan nyid tha dad khams kun dang / / nyin zhag dus dang zla phyed rgyud kyi rnam thar 'jug /
de ltar rgyal sras 'jigs med byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ / skyes bu khyu mchog ye shes rgyal srid thob zhugs pa/ / de dag 'di 'dra shes nas rjes su sems byed cing / / bde gshegs rnams la dga' ba mtha' yas yangs pa 'thob/ /
gang rnams bye ba khrag khrig sna tshogs lus bsgyur cing / / phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba thams cad mngon par mchod pa'i phyir/ / rnam 'phrul dam pa bzang po kun tu ston byed pa/ / de dag mgon po rnams kyi spyod yul rab la zhugs/ /
gang rnams sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig drung bslab cing / / gang rnams chos kyi mdzod rtogs yid la ngoms med de/ / gang dag mgon po khyu mchog rnams la dga' sems pa/ / de dag chos kyi sprin yin spyod pa mang la spyod/ /
ye shes 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi gnas mkhas pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas 'byung gnas ting 'dzin thob pa yin/ / ri rgyal lta bu de dag dad pa'i 'byung gnas rten/ / ye shes 'byung gnas 'gro ba'i yon tan 'byung gnas so/ /
gnas pa med pa dam pa shin tu yangs pa dang / / thams cad mkhyen la mngon gyur mya ngan med pa dang / / sems can skyob cing nyon mongs rnyog pa med zhugs pa'i/ / byams pa'i bsam pas 'gro ba kun kyang 'gengs/ /
de dag snying rje'i blo yang shin tu yangs pa yin/ / bdag la cir sems de bzhin sangs rgyas sems can la/ / gzhan du nam mkha' lta bur mtshan nyid med par 'jug / nyams par gyur pa'i sems can rnams mthong phyir zhing rtsom/ /
byang chub sems la mkhas pa dag gi tshad dag ni/ / bskal pa bye ba'i mthas kyang brjod par mi nus te/ / ci phyir zhe na de las sangs rgyas thams cad byung / / dbang bdes rim gror byas dang rang rgyal kun kyang byung / /
phyogs bcur zhing rnams grangs med bcur ni bgrangs gyur pa'i/ / sems can thams cad bskal pa gcig tu bder bkod cing / / bslab pa bcu dang dge bcu bsam gtan thob pa dang / / tshangs pa dag dang rnam grol zhi ba'i gnas bkod cing / /
de dag bskal pa bye bar bde bar rab bkod de/ / dgra bcom nyon mongs zhi la rab tu bkod byas kyang / / byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i tshogs kyi char mi rung / / byang chub sems dpa' zhugs ma thag tu tshogs chen gsog /

In a pore they see buddha-lands And also see all sentient beings: The three times and six dispositions are not the same — Day and night, month and hour, bondage and freedom.
Thus do enlightening beings of great knowledge Single-mindedly head for the sovereignty of truth. Meditating on the abode of the Enlightened, They obtain boundless great joy.
Enlightening beings multiply their bodies into countless billions To make offerings to all the enlightened ones; The manifestations of their spiritual powers are supreme, incomparable— They can abide in all the spheres of action of the Buddhas.
They praise and look up to all the countless Buddhas And deeply savor the treasuries of all their teachings. Seeing the Buddhas, hearing their teachings, they diligently practice them, Their hearts joyful, as if they were drinking ambrosial elixir of immortality.
Having attained the supreme concentration of the enlightened, They delve into all truths and their knowledge grows. Their faith is unshakable as a great mountain, Being a treasury of virtues for all living beings.
Their compassion is great, extending to all living creatures: All they hope will soon develop universal knowledge. Yet they are always without attachment or dependence; Shedding afflictions, they’ve attained freedom.
Vast in knowledge, with pity for sentient beings, They embrace all as the same as themselves. With awareness of emptiness, signlessness, and unreality, Yet they act, their minds unflagging.
The virtues of enlightening beings’ determination for enlightenment Could not be exhaustively told even in a billion eons, Because it produces all the Enlightened Ones, And the bliss of the self-enlightened and Buddhas’ disciples.
To give peace for countless eons To all the beings of the lands of the ten directions, Urging them to keep the five precepts and ten virtues, The four meditations, four equipoises, and such concentrations,
And also giving them bliss for many eons, Causing them to cut off delusions and become saints, Amasses virtue which may be immeasurable, But cannot compare to the virtue of the will for enlightenment.

nyon mongs med cing shin tu phra lam rtogs pa yin/ / rang rgyal sems can bye ba khrag khrig bkod gyur kyang / / bsod nams bsags pa des ni byang chub sems rab la/ / grangs dang cha dang bgrangs pa'i rnam par nyer mi 'gro /
zhing gi rdul ni tshad kyis shes par rung yang srid/ / skad cig sems kyis zhing mang yongs su 'das byas shing / / de ltar bskal pa brjod yas zad par 'gro byas na/ / zhing mtha' thug par rung srid byang chub sems mchog min/ /
mtha' rnams kun tu bskal pa mang po'i mtha' med de/ / sngon gyi mthar gyur bskal pa de bzhin ma 'ongs dang / / da ltar byung ba'i bskal pa zad dang thug med pa'i/ / bskal pa de dag zad srid byang chub sems ma yin/ /
ci phyir zhe na 'di ltar phyogs rnams kun bkang zhing / / rtog dang rnam rtog yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir/ / skad cig gcig gis dus gsum rtogs par bya don du/ / 'gro ba'i don du 'dod cing sems mchog rin chen skye/ /
phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams stong mang kun tu mtha' yas pa'i/ / 'gro ba rnams kyi mos pa bsam pa ci 'dra dang / / sbyor ba gang dang sems dang spyod pa de bzhin te/ / mthar thug rung srid mkha' 'dra'i byang chub sems mtha' min/ /
de ni 'di ltar phyogs bcu byams dang snying rje dang / / bsam pa chen pos 'gro ba thams cad rgyas byas shing / / thar pa'i don du sangs rgyas yon tan kun spyod phyir/ / rin chen sems kyi stobs ni tshad med rab tu skyes/ /
mos dang bsam pa yid bzhin yang dag sbyor ba dang / / 'gro ba'i dbang po sbyor ba sems dang spyod pa rnams/ / skad cig gcig gis ji bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes lta bu'i sems skyes so/ /
'gro ba'i las dang nyon mongs sna tshogs 'byams klas pa/ / gang gis khams gsum 'di dag tu ni skye 'gyur ba/ / de dag mtha' ni phyogs bcur rnyed par rung srid kyi/ / byang chub sems kyi mchog la kun tu mtha' med do/ /
ci phyir zhe na 'di ltar nyon mongs las grol ba'i/ / sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa'i don du skye/ / nyon mongs grol byed de bzhin las kyi rgyud kyang gcod/ / dus gsum mun pa sel cing mi zad snying rjes byung / /
phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mtha' yas ma lus thams cad dang / / sems can mang po thams cad sems gcig bskyed pa yis/ / spos dang me tog phreng ba byug pa dam pa dang / / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan bza' btung na bzas mchod par byed/ /
gzhan yang gdan gyi rnam pa 'chag sa dam pa dang / / pho brang mang po sna tshogs tsan+dan mchog bsangs pa/ / nor bu rin chen rnam par snang bas brgyan pa dang / / yid bzhin nor bu yid 'ong brgyan pas mchod byas te/ /
de ltar bde gshegs sems can mngon par mchod byed pas/ / bskal pa khrag khrig brjod du med pa zad byas kyang / / byang chub sems dpa'i bde bsags mthar phyin bde ba nyid/ / gang bsgrubs byang chub sems la mnyam par nyer mi 'gro /

Also, to cause millions to achieve individual awakening And attain the subtle path of noncontentious action, Does not amount to anything much at all Compared to the determination for enlightenment.
If one could pass billions of lands in an instant And did so for immeasurable eons, The number of these lands might be assessed, But the virtues of the will for enlightenment cannot be known.
The number of eons past, future, and present Is boundless, yet still might be known; But the virtue of rousing the mind to enlightenment Cannot be measured by anyone.
This is because the determination for enlightenment extends everywhere, Knowing all discernments that exist, Comprehending past, present, and future in an instant, Benefiting innumerable sentient beings.
The desires, understandings, means, and mental patterns Of the sentient beings of the worlds of the ten directions, As well as the bounds of space, might be measured, But the virtues of the aspirations for enlightenment cannot be assessed.
Enlightening beings’ aspiration is equal to the ten directions; Their kindness universally nourishes all living beings, Causing all to cultivate the virtues of buddhahood: That’s why their power has no bounds.
Sentient beings’ desires, understandings, inclinations, Faculties, devices, and practices are all different; Enlightening beings know them all instantly, Same as the mind of omniscience.
The deluded actions of living beings Continue through time without interruption, Yet their bounds still might be known; But the virtues of will for enlightenment are inconceivable.
Will for enlightenment can divorce afflictions of action And provide offerings to all the Enlightened: Once habitual delusions are divorced, their continuity’s broken, And liberation is attained for all time.
If one gives offerings to boundless Buddhas in an instant, And also gives to countless sentient beings, Fragrant flowers and garlands, Precious banners, canopies, and raiment,
Fine food, excellent seats, and places to walk around, Various palaces, all finely adorned, Luminous, wonderful pearls, Wish-fulfilling jewels, radiating light,
And brings such offerings moment after moment Over countless eons, beyond the power of speech, Though such a person’s accumulation of merit would be great, It does not equal the magnitude of the virtue of aspiring to enlightenment.

ji snyed dper brjod byas pa 'di dag thams cad kyang / / yang dag skyes pa'i byang chub sems kyi char mi rung / / de yang 'di ltar dus gsum bzhugs pa'i skyes bu mchog / thams cad byang chub sems mchog de las byung ba yin/ /
byang chub sems ni chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin te/ / thams cad tshad la gnas kyang de la tshad yod min/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gzhol zhing tshad med stobs/ / sems can rang bzhin de bzhin byang chub mthar yang phyin/ /
byang chub sems 'di nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa ste/ / chos rnams kun la khyab pa chos dbyings ji bzhin no/ / tshad med de bzhin nyid kun de yi spyod yul gyur/ / des ni kun tu khyab pa'i sems can gtso bo bzhin/ /
de ni 'byams klas chos rnams kun la rjes su zhugs/ / des ni zhing rnams ma lus 'byams klas kun tu khyab/ / des ni shes pa 'byams klas thams cad rtogs par chud/ / des ni sangs rgyas 'byams klas kun dang 'gal med thob/ /
rtag tu bsod nams bla na med pa dag dang ldan/ / de bzhin rtag tu tshul khrims rnam dag mi gnas ldan/ / rtag tu kun gtong rtag par rab tu dge ba ste/ / ldog pa med pa'i brtson 'grus mchog dang rab tu ldan/ /
bsam gtan mdzod la rtag par bsam gtan 'jug pa byed/ / shes rab shin tu langs pa dang yang rtag tu ldan/ / rgyal sras rnams kyi sa rab dam pa gang yod pa/ / de dag don du ye shes kun tu bzang po byung / /
'gro ba kun na skyes bu seng+ge gang bzhugs pa/ / de dag gis ni byang chub sems rab byin gyis brlabs/ / ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi dam pas rab tu brgyan/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam 'phrul rdzu 'phrul rnam pas brgyan/ /
'jig rten yun dang 'gro ba rnams kyi ji tsam tshad/ / nam mkha'i tshad kyang phyogs bcu dag tu ji tsam pa/ / de dag pas kyang byang chub sems 'di tshad med de/ / de las skyes bu'i seng+ge kun kyang skyes shing byung / /
byang chub sems 'di stobs bcu rnams kyi rtsa ba ste/ / brtan pa bzhi yi gnas yin so sor shes pa'i rtsa/ / rgyal ba'i chos rnams bco brgyad yang dag 'byin pa ste/ / skyes bu gtso bos mkhyen par bya ba'i chos kun 'byin/ /
gzugs kyi sku ni mtshan rab rnams kyis bsags pa dang / / chos sku mnyam nyid rtog pa mi mnga' brnyes pa dang / / 'gro bas mchod pa'i ye shes chags med gang byung ba/ / kun gyi rtsa ba 'byung gnas byang chub sems 'di yin/ /
rang rgyal theg pa 'byung zhing nyan thos theg pa'ang 'byung / / bsam gtan ting 'dzin bde ba gzugs kyi khams rnams dang / / gzugs med khams rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dag / kun gyi rtsa ba 'byung gnas byang chub sems mchog 'di yin no/ /
mi dang de bzhin lha yi dbang po'i bde ba dang / / lam rgyud sna tshogs kun kyang 'di la shin tu sbyangs/ / brtson 'grus stobs dang dbang po'i bde ba gang yod pa/ / kun gyi rtsa ba dang po byang chub sems 'di yin/ /

None of the various examples told Can match the determination for enlightenment, Because the most honorable people of all times Have all been born from this aspiration.
The will for enlightenment is unhindered, unlimited: No measure can be found for it. Vowing to fulfill omniscience, To forever deliver all beings,
That aspiration is vast as space, Producing virtues equal to the cosmos. Their share of action extending everywhere, as though there were no difference, Forever leaving all attachments, equal to the Buddhas,
Entering all gates of truth, Able to travel to all lands, Arriving at all spheres of knowledge, Perfecting all virtues,
Able to relinquish everything, always consistent, Purifying behavior, free from attachment, Fulfilling unsurpassed virtues, Always persevering without regression,
Entering deep concentration, always meditating, Uniting with vastly great knowledge and wisdom: This is the supreme stage of enlightening beings, Producing the path of all the Universally Good.
All the Enlightened Ones of past, present, and future Protect the initial aspiration, Adorning it with spiritual powers and mystic transfiguration, With concentrations and spells.
The living beings of the ten directions are infinite, As are the worlds and space: But the infinity of the enlightenment aspiration surpasses these: Hence it can give birth to all Buddhas.
The will for enlightenment is the basis of the ten powers As well as the four special knowledges and fearlessnesses. The same is true of the eighteen unique qualities: All of them are attained from the aspiration for enlightenment.
The Buddhas’ physically adorned bodies, As well as their equal body of reality, Their knowledge, wisdom, and nonattachment, worthy of honor, All can exist because of the determination for enlightenment.
All the vehicles of individual illuminates and Buddhist disciples, The pleasures of the meditation states of the realm of form, As well as the trances of the formless realm, All have the will for enlightenment as their basis.
The free pleasures of humans and gods, As well as the various pleasures of the other states of being, And the pleasures of progress, concentration, religious faculties and powers, and so on, All depend on the first aspiration to enlightenment.

ci phyir zhe na 'di ltar byang chub sems bskyed cing / / pha rol phyin drug brtson par spyad pa rab tu spyod/ / sems can rnams la'ang spyod pa yang dag rab tu ston/ / des ni khams gsum 'gro ba'i bde ba kun kyang 'byung / /
sangs rgyas chags med thugs chud don dam mkhyen pa rnams/ / chos kyi dam pa mchog rnams yang dag kun ston cing / / rgya chen nyon mongs las las sems can dgrol mdzad de/ / mya ngan 'das pa dam pa mchog la dgod mdzad pa/ /
ye shes 'od zer 'od yangs nyi ma lta bu ste/ / 'gro bar spyod pa dkar pos yongs rgyas zla ba bzhin/ / yon tan shin tu bsags pa tshad med chu lta bu/ / dri med chags pa mi mnga' tshad med mkha' dbyings 'dra/ /
gang zhig yon tan mtha' yas byang chub sems yangs pa/ / shin tu che zhing bde skyed tshad med smon byed cing / / phyi ma'i mthar thug spyod par smon pas su brtson pa/ / de dag sems can gdul ba'i don phyir rtag tu brtson/ /
'jig rten 'byams klas thams cad rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir/ / smon lam bye ba khrag khrig bsam gyis mi khyab dang / / stong pa mtshan ma med pa smon med mi gnas pa'i/ / smon lam bye ba brgyas ni sems de dag par 'gyur/ /
chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu sus rtogs shing / / zhi dang rab zhi nyer zhig thams cad mnyam gzhog pa/ / de dag chos grangs khrag khrig bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / grangs su 'gro la ston kyang de ni gnas pa med/ /
phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gtso bo ji snyed pa/ / de dag kun gyis byang chub sems mchog 'di bsngags te/ / yon tan brgya phrag bsam gyis mi khyab pas kyang brgyan/ / sems can gtso bzhin yongs dag pha rol phyin pa yin/ /
bskal pa sems can snyed du gal te legs brjod kyang / / byang chub sems rab de la mthar thug gang yang med/ / rgyal ba 'byung ba'i rigs chen der ni gang skyes pa/ / de yi dpe ni khams gsum glongs kyang gang yang med/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyis gang zhig rnam bsags pa'i; ; byang chub sems rab de la smon lam kun gyi gyis/ / byang chub sems rab dam pa de ni bsod nams gter/ / des ni rgyal sras chags pa med pa rab tu 'thob/ /
'gro ba'i sems dang spyod pa shes shing mthong rung srid/ / zhing rnams rdul du blags te bgrangs par nus kyang srid/ / bar snang skra yis mnyam par gzhal bar nus srid kyi/ / byang chub sems mchog yon tan mthar phyin mi nus so/ /
'di las dus gsum sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu byung / / 'di las 'jig rten 'gro ba kun gyi bde ba 'byung / / 'di las rgyal bas bsngags pa'i legs pa thams cad 'byung / / 'dis ni sems can gtso bo the tshom med par 'gyur/ /
'dis ni 'jig rten kun gyi sgrib pa zad par 'gyur; ; 'dis ni zhing rnams yongs su dag pa'i mchog tu 'gyur/ / 'di las 'jig rten dam pa shes dang ldan pa 'byung / / gang zhig phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba blta bar 'dod pa dang / /
gang zhig byin dang bsod nams mi zad mdzod 'dod dang / / gang zhig 'gro ba kun gyi sdug bsngal zlog 'dod pa/ / des ni yon tan mtha' yas byang chub sems bskyed bya; ;

Based on the production of this far-reaching determination Can one practice the six ways of transcendence: Urging sentient beings to carry out right practice, Experiencing peace and happiness in the three realms,
Abiding in the Buddhas’ unhindered true knowledge, Revealing all the wonderful actions there are, Able to cause countless living beings To cut off deluded actions and turn to nirvana,
Making vows of boundless virtues To give happiness to all living beings, Carrying out these vows forever and ever, Always working so as to liberate beings,
The infinite great vows inconceivable, Vowing to purify all living beings— Though empty, signless, wishless, without reliance, By the power of will, enlightening beings can reveal them.
Understanding the inherent nature of things is like space; That all are quiescent, all equal, The gates of the teaching, countless, unspeakable, They expound to beings, without attachment.
All Enlightened Ones of the worlds of the ten directions All praise the first aspiration for enlightenment; This inspired mind is adorned by infinite virtues And can arrive at the other shore, same as the Buddhas.
Were those virtues to be expounded for as many eons As there are living beings, they could not be all told. Because this mind dwells in the vast house of the Enlightened, Nothing of the world can compare it or explain it.
If you want to know all the truths of the Buddhas, You should quickly develop the determination for enlightenment. This determination is the most excellent of virtues, Assuring attainment of the unhindered knowledge of the enlightened.
The mental activities of living beings might be counted, And so might the number of atoms in a land; The extent of space might be assessed, But the virtues of the will for enlightenment cannot be measured:
It produces all the Buddhas of all times, And perfects happiness in all worlds, Increases all excellent virtues, Extirpates all confusion,
Reveals all wondrous realms, Eliminates all obstacles, Develops all pure lands, Produces all enlightened knowledge.
If you want to see all the Buddhas of the ten directions, And want to disburse from the inexhaustible treasury of virtue, If you want to extinguish the afflictions of beings, Quickly arouse the will for enlightenment.

shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po'i dpe yang dag par bsags pa tshigs su bcad pa'i le'u zhes bya ste/ nyi shu gnyis pa'o// //
[23. chos snang ba'i le'u]
BOOK EIGHTEEN. Clarifying Method

de nas byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus blo gros kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pa rab tu thob pa/ sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas pa/ de ltar tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgya chen po la yang dag par 'dzeg pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa shin tu chud pa/ 'jig rten kun tu khrid par byed pa rnam par zlog pa/ rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyid kyi rjes su song ba/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa la shin tu nges pa/ rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rab tu gzhol ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la ji ltar brtson par byas pa'i rnam pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa las 'das par 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gter chen po rab tu thob par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams la snod ji bzhin du sbyin pa byed par 'gyur ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs yongs su mi gtong bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar dam bcas pa'i sems can rnams sgrol bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi gdung mi 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dmigs pa thams cad du sbyor ba don med par mi 'gyur ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de la brtson par byas pas chos kyi yul 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar ji ltar brtsam par bya ba de legs par bshad par mdzod cig/ 'khor 'di dag thams cad ni/ nyan par 'dod do/ /

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Vigorous Wisdom said to the enlightening being Truth Wisdom: “O Child of Buddha: when great enlightening beings first arouse the mind to seek all-knowledge, they fulfill such infinite virtues, are replete with great adornments, climb up into the vehicle of omniscience, enter the correct state of enlightening beings, give up all worldly things and attain the transmundane truths of the Buddhas, are taken into the company of all the Buddhas of past, present, and future, and will certainly reach the ultimate point of unexcelled enlightenment: how should those enlightening beings practice the Buddha-teachings so as to cause all the Enlightened Ones joy, enter the abode of all enlightening beings, attain purity of all great actions, fulfill all great vows, obtain the vast treasuries of enlightening beings, always teach according to necessity and potential for edification without ever giving up the transcending practices, cause all sentient beings under their care to attain deliverance, and continue the lineage of the three treasures unbroken, that their good roots and adaptive skills not be wasted? O Child of Buddha, by what techniques can they cause these things to be fulfilled? Please extend your compassion to explain for us—everyone in this assembly wants to hear.

sems can chen po de dag gis brtson pa'i rnam pa ji lta bus ma rig pa'i mun nag thams cad bsal te bdud kyi dkrugs ma'i 'khor thams cad las shin tu rgyal bar byas nas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis mnan te sems kyi dri ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kun nas bsal nas dge ba'i rtsa ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad shin tu bsgrubs te/ mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad rnam par bzlog nas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor chen po rnam par byang bar byas te byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su dag pa rnams mngon par bsgrubs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rgyan mngon par sgrub pa yongs su rgyas par byas te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar mngon par byang chub nas kyang bsam pa'i tshul bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su grub par gyur pa dag tu ji ltar yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can dag la dus dang / dbang po'i rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' yas pa 'byin par 'gyur ba de legs par shod cig / 'khor 'di dag thams cad ni/ nyan par 'dod do/ / ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan 'di dang / gzhan dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi yul rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas te myur du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnyam pa nyid 'thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bskal pa brgya stong grangs med par yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i chos kyi mdzod 'di yang yang dag par srung zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas shing ston pa dang / 'chad pa'i tshe bdud dam/ bdud kyi rigs su gtogs pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang skyo ba med par dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / de yang dag par ston pa'i tshe lha'i dbang po rnams kyis rim gror bya ba dang / gzhung de bzhin du klu'i dbang po dang / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po dang / dri za'i dbang po dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po dang / nam mkha' lding gi dbang po dang / mi'am ci'i dbang po dang / lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po dang / mi'i dbang po dang / tshangs pa'i dbang pos rim gror bya ba rab tu 'thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbang pos rim gror bya ba rab tu 'thob pa dang / de ltar rim gror byas nas kyang 'jig rten thams cad kyis phyag bya ba/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis mngon par mchod pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis shin tu dgongs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis shin tu bsrung ba; rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang smon lam rab tu thob pa/ chos dkar po chen po yang dag par spel ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod rnam par 'byed par 'gyur ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa rgya chen po rab tu 'byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rim gyis spyod pa yongs su sgrub pa shin tu ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas dag yang dag par bstan pa mdzod cig /

“Furthermore, if great enlightening beings always diligently practice, to annihilate all the darkness of ignorance, conquer demons and enemies and control heretics, forever wash away all afflictions defiling the mind, they will all be able to perfect all roots of goodness, forever escape the difficulties of all miserable realms of being, purify all spheres of great knowledge, accomplish all the stages of enlightenment and their pure virtues—the transcending practices, mnemonic mastery, concentration, the six superknowledges, and the four fearlessnesses—adorning all Buddha-lands; their physical refinements as well, their bodily, verbal, and mental actions will all be perfectly complete. They will know well all the powers, fearlessnesses, unique qualities, omniscience, and spheres of action of all the Enlightened Ones, the Buddhas. In order to develop and mature all living beings according to their mentalities, they will take appropriate buddha-lands and expound the truth as necessary in accord with beings’ faculties and in accord with the time and situation. They will fulfill various immeasurable great Buddha-works, as well as innumerable other virtuous things, various practices, paths, and realms, and soon be equal to the enlightened ones. They can maintain and protect all the treasuries of truths assembled by the perfectly enlightened ones over their hundreds and thousands of immeasurable eons of cultivating enlightening practices, and can expound them unhindered and undisrupted by demons or heretics. They will hold the true teaching forever, and in all worlds when they teach they will be protected by celestial beings, yaksha kings, gandharva kings, titan kings, garuda kings, kinnara kings, mahoraga kings, human kings, Brahma kings, and enlightened kings of truth. All worlds will respect and support them, alike crowning them. They will always be under the care of the Buddhas, and will also be loved and respected by all enlightening beings. Attaining the power of roots of goodness, they will increase virtuous ways, expound the treasury of profound teachings of the Enlightened, and hold the true teaching, wherewith they will adorn themselves. Please expound the process of enlightening beings’ practices.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus blo gros kyis don 'di nyid bstan te brjod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the enlightening being Vigorous Wisdom, wanting to reiterate his intention, spoke these verses:

spyod la 'jug pa mtha' yas yangs pa dag / rang byung ye shes sgrub pa dge ba rnams/ / rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan can/ / grags pa chen po rnams la legs par shod/ /
byang chub sems dpa' gang rnams sems thob cing / / bsod nams ldan pa ye shes thob pa rnams/ / skyon med zhugs pas 'jig rten rnams zlog cing / / yang dag sangs rgyas chos mnyam nyid thob rnams/ /
de dag gis ni bde gshegs bstan pa la/ / brtson 'grus brtan pas ji ltar brtson par bya/ / gang gis phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba mnyes byas shing / / yang dag sangs rgyas sa'ang gnan bya dang / /
spyod pa dag dang smon lam yong dag dang / / ye shes gter chen rab tu 'thob 'gyur zhing / / thob nas de dag 'gro kun mi gnas pas/ / yongs su blangs pa rtag tu gtong byed dang / /
gang yang pha rol phyin pa mchog gi lam/ / de dag mi gtong rab tu spyod pa dang / / sems can ji ltar sgrol byed dam bcas shing / / yang dag sangs rgyas bsam pa mnyam 'dzin dang / /
mig gi dmigs pa brten pa thams cad kyi/ / 'byung ba yon tan can la stob 'gyur zhing / / skyes bu khyu mchog de dag brtson 'gyur ba'i/ / rnam dag lam de khyu mchog khyod kyis ston/ /
ji ltar de dag mun pa kun bsal cing / / 'khrug pa'i 'khor rnams thams cad pham byas nas/ / dri ma bral ba'i dge ldan mkhas pa rnams/ / skyes bu khyu mchog ye shes ldan 'gyur dang / /
mi khom ngan song lam rnams yongs spangs shing / / ye shes chen po'i dkyil 'khor mchog spyod dang / / yon tan bzang po thams cad ldan gyur cing / / rgyal ba'i ye shes stobs kyang 'thob 'gyur dang / /
skyes bu khyu mchog ye shes zhugs nas kyang / / sems can bsam pa ji bzhin ston byed cing / / mtha' yas yangs pa'i zhing rnams bsam yas su/ / ston pa chen po'i las kyang byed pa dang / /
ci nas de dag spyod pa mchog thob nas/ / mi yi khyu mchog mdzod rnams ston byed de/ / zil gyis mi non gzhan gyis mi pham par/ / rgyal ba'i chos nyid rtag tu 'dzin byed ston/ /
seng+ge bzhin du ji ltar 'jigs pa med/ / ji ltar zla bzhin dag pa'i mdog tu spyod/ / chu la pad+mo bzhin du chags med pa/ / de dag rgyal ba'i yon tan ji ltar spyod/ /
de skad ces smras pa dang /

O famous one, well do you expound The virtues accomplished by enlightening beings, Deeply entering boundless great action Fulfilling pure teacherless knowledge.
If enlightening beings, at their first inspiration, Accomplish the practice of virtue and wisdom, Enter the rank of freedom from birth, transcending the world, Universally attaining the principle of true enlightenment,
Then how should they, in the Buddha-teaching, Stably and strongly practice with diligence, to progress further, To cause all the Enlightened Ones to rejoice, To be able to quickly enter the state of the Buddhas,
Fulfill all the pure vows they carry out, And attain the vast treasury of knowledge and wisdom, And also be able to teach the truth to liberate beings Without their minds relying on or attached to anything,
Fulfill all the transcendent ways of enlightening beings, Rescue and liberate all beings under their care, Forever maintain the lineage of Buddhas unbroken, So all they do is sure and not in vain,
And they accomplish all tasks and win emancipation.
Please explain this pure path, In accord with what all the Victors practice, To forever destroy the darkness of ignorance, Overthrow all demons and heretics,
Wash away all defilements, To be able to approach the great knowledge and wisdom of the Enlightened And forever leave the dangers of the evil ways, To purify the extraordinary spheres of great knowledge,
Attain the powers of the sublime way, next to the Supreme Honored One, To fulfill all virtues, Realize the supreme knowledge of the Enlightened, Live in innumerable lands
And expound the truth according to the mentalities of the beings there, And perform the various great deeds of Buddhas.
How can they attain the wonderful paths And expound the treasury of true teachings of the Enlightened, Always able to accept and hold the Buddha-teachings, Unsurpassable and incomparable?
How can they be fearless like lions, Their acts pure as the full moon? How can they cultivate the Buddhas’ virtues, Like lotuses to which water does not adhere?

byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros kyis byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus blo gros la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod ni/ skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa shin tu rtogs shing rnam par dag par brtsams te 'dri zhing / de ltar rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dri ba chos mang po la rab tu gnas pa/ brtson 'grus chen pos shin tu bsags pa brtson 'grus ldog pa med pas shin tu byung ba 'dri bar byed pa ni/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ legs so/ / legs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs tsam bstan par bya'o/ /

Then the enlightening being Truth Wisdom said to the enlightening being Vigorious Wisdom, “Very good, Child of Buddha; you have asked about the pure practice cultivated by enlightening beings, out of compassion for the world, because you wish that many be aided and comforted, that many be benefited. Child of Buddha, you abide by the truth, you activate great vigor, increasing without recession; having already attained liberation, you are able to pose this question, the same as an enlightened one. Listen clearly, think well upon this; now, by the spiritual power of Buddha, I will explain a little of it for you.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa thob pa rnams kyis thog mar sems bskyed pa de mi nyams par yongs su bsrung ba dang / rim gror bya ba'i phyir bag yod par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la rnam pa bcus ni/ byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ tshul khrims kyi phung po shin tu bsrungs ba dang / byang chub kyi sems ma nyams shing shin tu sbyangs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa g.yo dang sgyu med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor ba phyir mi ldog pa dang / rang gi sems bskyed pa shin tu rtogs pa dang / phyogs khyim pa dang so so'i skye bo dang ma 'dres pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las 'jig rten gyi 'du shes dang 'dod pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs pa rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsam pa nan tan rgyun chad pa med pa dang / bdag gi rgyud kyi stobs kyi shugs shin tu brtag pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rnam pa bcu po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ bag yod pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o/ /

“Child of Buddha, once enlightening beings have developed the determination for omniscience, they should leave the darkness of ignorance and diligently guard themselves from indulgence and laxity. If enlightening beings abide by ten things, that is called nonindulgence: one is to keep the behavioral precepts; second is to abandon folly and purify the will for enlightenment; third is to like straightforwardness and reject flattery and deception; fourth is to earnestly cultivate virtues without regressing; fifth is to continually reflect on one’s aspiration; sixth is not to enjoy association with ordinary people, whether they be householders or monks; seventh is to do good deeds without hoping for worldly rewards; eighth is to forever leave lesser vehicles and practice the path of enlightening beings; ninth is to gladly practice what is good, not letting goodness be cut off; tenth is to always examine one’s own power of perseverance. If enlightening beings practice these ten things, this is called abiding in nonindulgence.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa la gnas pa rnam pa bcus ni/ yongs su dag par 'gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar smras pa de ltar byed pa yin/ shes bzhin gyi dran pa can yin/ khengs pa med cing g.yeng ba med de bsam gtan zab mo la rab tu gnas pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo btsal ba la nan tan du byed cing rgyun mi gcod pa yin/ lhag mthong mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas shing ji ltar thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin du rtog par zhugs pa yin/ bsam gtan gyi rjes su song ba'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo'i rjes su song ba yin/ sa dang mnyam zhing mthon dman dang bral ba yin/ sbyor ba bzang ngan dang bar ma la sems nyams pa med pa yin/ sems can kun gyi nang na chung ngu na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems gcig bskyed pa la yang ston pa'i bsam pa thob pa yin/ mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / chos smra ba rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / ngang tshul can du gnas pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rnam pa bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa/ brtson 'grus brtsams pa/ dran pa nye bar gzhag pa/ mos pa che ba/ rnal 'byor rgyun ma chad pa/ chos thams cad la mi gnas pa/ chos thams cad la brtson pa/ nyon mongs pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa; sems yangs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbus med pa'i rjes su song ba rnams kyis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par 'gyur te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpas chos bcus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bya'o/ /

“When enlightening beings persist in nonindulgence, they attain ten kinds of purity: (1) acting in accord with what they say; (2) consummation of attention and discernment; (3) abiding in deep concentration without torpor or agitation; (4) gladly seeking Buddha-teachings without flagging; (5) contemplating the teachings heard according to reason, fully developing skillfully flexible knowledge; (6) entering deep meditation and attaining the psychic powers of Buddhas; (7) their minds are equanimous, without sense of high or low status; (8) in regard to superior, middling, and inferior types of beings, their minds are unobstructed, and like the earth, they benefit all equally; (9) if they see any beings who have even once made the determination for enlightenment, they honor and serve them as teachers; (10) they always respect, serve, and support their preceptors and tutors, and all enlightening beings, wise friends, and teachers. These are called the ten kinds of purity of enlightening beings persisting in nonindulgence. “Enlightening beings abide in nonindulgence, evoke great vigor, produce correct mindfulness, engender supreme aspiration, and work unceasingly. Their minds are free from dependence on any thing. They are able to diligently cultivate the most profound teaching, and enter the gate of noncontention. Broadening their minds, they are able to accordingly comprehend boundless Buddha-teachings, causing the Enlightened Ones to all rejoice.

bcu gang zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus thams cad la phyir mi ldog pa dang / lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i rkyen la don du gnyer ba med pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par sgom pas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par gzhol ba'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i chos rnam par sgom pa'i phyag rgya dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sgrub pa'i smon lam chen po dang / yongs su sbyangs pa'i bzod pa shes pa'i snang ba dang / rang gi dge ba'i chos bsags pa dang ma bsags pa shin tu brtags pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i sgo shin tu byang ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par bya'o/ /

“There are ten more things by which enlightening beings can cause the Buddhas to rejoice: (1) persevering without regression; (2) not begrudging their physical life; (3) not seeking profit or support; (4) knowing all things are like space; (5) being skillful at contemplation, entering into all realms of reality; (6) knowing the definitive marks of all things; (7) always invoking great vows; (8) developing the light of pure tolerant knowledge; (9) examining one’s own virtues without exaggeration or underestimation; (10) cultivating pure practices in accord with the way of nonstriving. This is called enlightening beings persisting in ten things whereby they are able to bring joy to all the Enlightened Ones.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' chos bcu la gnas pa rnams kyis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par 'gyur ba yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ bag yod pa la gnas pa dang / mi skye ba'i bzod pa la gnas pa dang / snying rje chen po la gnas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas pa dang / spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la gnas pa dang / smon lam mngon par sgrub pa la gnas pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la gnas pa dang / brtan pa'i stobs kyi shugs la gnas pa dang / chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bu la rab tu gnas pa dang / len pa med pa la gnas pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par 'gyur ro/ /

“There are ten more things by which they can make all Buddhas joyful: abiding securely in nonindulgence; abiding securely in acceptance of nonorigination; abiding securely in great kindness; abiding securely in great compassion; abiding securely in the fulfillment of the transcendent ways; abiding securely in the enlightening practices; abiding securely in great vows; abiding securely in skillful means; abiding securely in dauntless power; abiding securely in knowledge and wisdom, observing all things have no abode, like empty space. If enlightening beings abide in these ten things, they can cause all Buddhas joy.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la chos bcu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ sa rnam par dgod pa las 'da' ba yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu bsags pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par phye ba tshad med pa'i lam gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i ye shes snang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa rgyun ma chad pa dang / brtson 'grus zhig pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis legs par bslab pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor bas mi skyo ba dang / theg pa'i rgyan shin tu bshams pa dang / ye shes kyi bsam pa rab tu rno ba dang / sa dang sa ma yin pa'i chos kyi sgo la mi gnas pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa nas sar rnam par dgod pa las 'da' ba yin no/ /

“There are ten things which cause enlightening beings to quickly enter the stages: (1) skillfully fulfilling the twin practices of virtue and knowledge; (2) ability to greatly adorn the path of the transcendent practices; (3) knowledge clearly comprehending, not following others’ words; (4) serving good friends, never abandoning them; (5) always practicing perseverance, without laziness; (6) skillful ability to abide in the psychic powers of Buddhas; (7) cultivating roots of goodness without growing wearied; (8) with a deep mind and incisive knowledge, adorning oneself with the teaching of the Great Vehicle; (9) the mind not dwelling on the teachings of each stage; (10) being of the same essential nature as all Buddhas of all times in virtue and liberative means. These ten things cause enlightening beings to quickly enter the stages.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni/ thog ma nas sa rnam par dgod pa thams cad la mkhas pa rnam par dpyod pa yin te; chos kyi sgo gang gis gang khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes kyi sgo gang gis thob par 'gyur ba dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gang yin pa dang / spyod yul gang yin pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa gang yin pa dang / yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa dang / chos kyi sgo rnam par dbye ba'i khyad par gang yin pa dang / ji ltar thob par bya ba thams cad kyang rnam par dpyod do/ / de dag la shin tu rnam par dpyad pas chos thams cad la mi gnas shing / sems kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yang dag par 'da'o/ /

“Furthermore, when enlightening beings are in the first stage, they should carefully investigate all the principles and knowledge pertaining to it, the causes cultivated there, the effects realized, the spheres, functions, manifestations, distinctions, and attainments pertaining to it. They should carefully examine and realize that all things are one’s own mind, and have no attachments to anything; with this knowledge they enter the stages of enlightening beings and can steadfastly continue therein.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ 'di ltar bdag cag gis ci nas kyang myur du 'da' bar bya'o; ;snyam du mi sems te/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar de dag 'di snyam du sems te/ bdag cag sa nas sa la rnam par gnas pas/ ji lta ji ltar yang dag par gnas pa de lta de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs ches che ba skye bar 'gyur te/ ji lta ji ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po skyes par gyur pa de lta de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i rjes su song zhing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa tshad med pas nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro/ /snyam ste/ de dag sbyor ba rgyun ma chad cing / skyo ba med pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / tshogs kyi rgyan chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam par dgod pa las yang dag par 'da'o/ /

“Those enlightening beings formulate these thoughts: ‘We should quickly enter the stages. Why? If we sojourn in stage after stage, we will develop such great virtuous qualities; being replete with virtue, we will gradually enter the stage of buddhahood; once we are in the stage of buddhahood, we can perform boundless great buddha-works. Therefore we should always practice diligently and unremittingly, without wearying, adorning ourselves with great virtues and enter the stages of enlightening beings.’

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnam pa bcus spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyang bar bya ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ yo byad yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bzod pa dang des pa mi zad pa'i sa'i rjes su song ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / dran pa'i stobs kyi shugs rmongs pa med pa dang / gcig las rnam pa tha dad pa'i chos kyi rjes su song zhing khong du chud pa dang / gnas med pa'i spyod pa sgrub dka' ba thams cad la sems ri'i rgyal po lta bu dang / sems can thams cad ma 'dres pa'i mu stegs su gyur pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rnam pa bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ /

“There are ten things which cause the practices of enlightening beings to be pure: (1) giving up all possessions to satisfy the wishes of sentient beings; (2) adhering to pure morality, not transgressing; (3) being inexhaustibly gentle and tolerant; (4) cultivating practices diligently without regressing; (5) being free from confusion and mental disturbance, through the power of correct mindfulness; (6) analyzing and comprehending the innumerable teachings; (7) cultivating all practices without attachment; (8) being mentally imperturbable, like a great mountain; (9) extensively liberating living beings, like a bridge; (10) knowing that all living beings are in essence the same as the Buddhas. These ten things make enlightening beings’ practices pure.

de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de ltar yongs su sbyangs pa des rnam pa bcus shin tu dag par 'gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ sems can gyi gtso bo 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pas yang dag par dgongs pa dang / 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i grogs kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par gzung ba la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang dag par brten pa dang / mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa la rab tu gnas pa dang / chos tha dad pa thams cad la tha mi dad par rtogs pa dang / snying rje'i byin gyi rlabs shin tu che ba dang / chos thams cad yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par lta ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dpyod pa'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rnam pa bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ /

“Once enlightening beings have attained purity in practice, they also attain ten even greater things: (1) the Buddhas of other realms always protect them; (2) their roots of goodness increase, going beyond any comparison; (3) they are able to receive the boosting power of the Buddhas; (4) they always find good people and are relied on by them; (5) they remain diligent and are never heedless; (6) they know all things are equal and not different; (7) their minds always abide in unexcelled great compassion; (8) they observe things as they really are, producing sublime wisdom; (9) they are able to practice skillful techniques of liberation; (10) they are able to know the Enlightened Ones’ power of skill in liberative means. These are the ten excellent qualities of enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnam par dag pa bcu ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ skyo ba med par sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bsags pas 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam dang / lus dang srog gis bsngo zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i smon lam dang / ye shes kyi sgo rnam par dpyad pa khong du chud pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing la 'jug pa'i smon lam dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang gnyis su med pas tshul gcig gi rgyud du 'gro ba'i smon lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgo la 'jug pas chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i smon lam dang / mos pa rnam par sbyangs pas blta na don yod pa'i smon lam dang / phyi ma'i mthar byin gyis brlabs pas bskal par gnas pa'i smon lam dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i theg pa'i rgyan rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas rnam par sbyangs pa'i smon lam dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ de ltar smon lam rnam par sbyong ngo/ /

“Enlightening beings have ten pure vows: (1) they vow to develop living beings to maturity, without wearying; (2) they vow to fully practice all virtues and purify all worlds; (3) they vow to serve the Enlightened, always engendering honor and respect; (4) they vow to keep and protect the true teaching, not begrudging their lives; (5) they vow to observe with wisdom and enter the lands of the Buddhas; (6) they vow to be of the same essence as all enlightening beings; (7) they vow to enter the door of realization of thusness and comprehend all things; (8) they vow that those who see them will develop faith and all be benefited; (9) they vow to stay in the world forever by spiritual power; (10) they vow to fulfill the practice of Universal Good, and master the knowledge of all particulars and all ways of liberation. These are the ten pure vows of enlightening beings.

de dag rnam pa bcus smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed de/ bcu gang zhe na/ yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / rgya chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' smon lam khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thos nas rang gi smon lam du mngon par sgrub pa dang / bsam pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya bar gtugs pa'i smon lam chen po dang ldan pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas pas mi 'jigs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis ci mi snyam pa dang / bde ba thams cad la ye mi rngam pa dang / bsam pa mnyam pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa yongs su srung ba dag ste/

“Enlightening beings can successfully fulfill their great vows by abiding by ten principles: (1) never wearying in mind; (2) preparing great adornments; (3) remembering the superlative will power of enlightening beings; (4) when hearing about the Buddha-lands, vowing to be born in them all; (5) keeping their profound determination everlasting; (6) vowing to develop all living beings fully; (7) staying through all ages without considering it troublesome; (8) accepting all suffering without aversion; (9) having no craving for or attachment to any pleasures; (10) always diligently protecting the unexcelled teaching.

de dag smon lam chen po de ltar yongs su sbyong zhing yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe sangs rgyas mthong ba'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /gzungs 'khrul pa med pa'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /smon lam zad mi shes pas chos thams cad shin tu rtogs pa'i gzungs kyang rab tu 'thob bo/ /snying rje chen pos 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud kyi gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /'gro ba thams cad tshim par bya ba'i bsod nams kyi gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa'i ye shes kyi gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ / rnam par smin pa la gnas pa mngon par sgrub pa'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs mtha' yas pa'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med par gtogs pa la 'jug pa'i gter zad mi shes pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ / de ltar gter rab tu thob cing bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pa dang ldan pa de dag ye shes chen po'i dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pas; sems can rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi gter gyi sbyin pa byed do/ / de la rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ji ltar 'jug ce na/ sbyor ba ji lta bur rgyu ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen ji lta ba dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i sbyor ba ji lta ba las sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug ste/ de dag de ltar bsam pa la zhugs pa rnams sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing chos yang dag par ston te; de dag 'dod chags kyi bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir mi sdug pa yang dag par ston to/ / zhe sdang gi bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir byams pa chen po'i sbyor ba yang dag par ston to/ / gti mug gi bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa yang dag par ston to/ / cha mnyam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sgo yang dag par ston to/ / 'khor ba'i bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa yang dag par ston to/ / gnas kyi bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir gnas med pa'i chos kyi sgo yang dag par ston to/ / zhum pa'i bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir rgya chen po'i yul yang dag par ston to/ / bdag gi nga rgyal gyis bcom pa'i bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chos kyi mnyam pa nyid yang dag par ston to/ / g.yo dang sgyus mi mnyam pa'i bsam pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / zhi ba'i gnas kyi bsam pa mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par ston to/ / de dag ni/ de ltar sems can rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi gter yang dag par ston te/

“When enlightening beings have attained these ten treasuries, their virtue is complete, their knowledge is pure; they explain the truth to sentient beings according to their needs and capacities. How do enlightening beings explain the truth to sentient beings according to their needs and capacities? They know what beings do; they know their causes and conditions; they know their mental behavior; they know their inclinations. To those with much greed and desire they expound impurity; to those with much anger and hatred they expound magnanimity and kindness; to those with much ignorance and delusion they teach diligent contemplation; to those in whom these poisons of greed, hatred, and ignorance are equal, they expound the teaching of the development of the knowledge to overcome them. Those who like birth and death they teach about the three kinds of suffering. To those who are attached to where they are, they teach the empty nullity of places. To those who are lazy they talk of great vigor. To those who harbor conceit they explain the equality of things. To flatterers and deceivers they tell of the simple honesty of the hearts of enlightening beings. To those who like silence and tranquility they expound the Teaching extensively, so that they will accomplish it. Thus do enlightening beings teach according to what is necessary and appropriate.

de yang don dbyer med pa yang dag par ston to/ / yi ge'i mtshams 'byor bar sbyar bas yang dag par ston to/ / shes pa rnam par dbye bas yang dag par ston to/ / bstan pa snga phyi ma 'dres pas yang dag par ston to/ / chos kyi tshul dang tshul ma yin pa'i bye brag dbyer med pas yang dag par ston to/ / mtshan nyid kyi phyag rgya rnam par mi 'khrug pas yang dag par ston to/ / chos rab tu dgod pa rgyun chad pa med pas yang dag par ston to/ / mtha' yas pa sbyad [*spyad?] pas yang dag par ston to/ / the tshom thams cad shin tu gcad pa'i phyir yang dag par ston to/ / dbang po'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag par ston to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya la dgod par gzhol bas yang dag par ston to/ / yang dag pa'i mtha' mtshan nyid med pa rnam par mi 'khrug pas yang dag par ston to/ / chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par gzhol bas yang dag par ston to/ / chos kyi rnga yang dag par brdung bas yang dag par ston to/ / gnas thams cad yang dag par spangs pas yang dag par ston to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su dran pa mi gtong bas yang dag par ston to/ / tshig dang skad dang sgra dang ngag gi lam thams cad mnyam pa nyid la mi gnas pas yang dag par ston to/ / rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings kyi rjes su 'gro bas yang dag par ston to/ / dpe thams cad rnam par dgod pas rgyud dang mi 'gal bar brtan par bya bas yang dag par ston to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rang gi lus su sems pa la yang dag par gzhol bas yang dag par ston to/ /

When they expound the Teaching, their expressions interlink, the meanings are free from contradiction and confusion. They observe the context of the teachings, analyze them wisely, determine right and wrong, accord with the definitive marks of things—impermanence, dispassion, and selflessness—and progressively set up boundless practical approaches, to cause all sentient beings to cut off all doubt. They know all faculties well, enter into the teachings of the enlightened, experience true reality, know things are equal, cut off all attachment to things, eliminate all clinging, and always remember the Buddhas, their minds never leaving them for a moment. They know the substance and essence of sounds are equal, and have no attachment to verbalizations. They can skillfully expound examples and allegories, without any contradiction, to make everyone able to realize the impartial body of wisdom which all the Buddhas manifest everywhere according to need and suitability.

de ltar sems can la chos yang dag par ston cing rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi nan tan gyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / rang gi don gting tshugs par byed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs mi gtong bas rgya chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa yang dag par sgrub bo/ / de la'ang sems can thams cad tshim par bya ba dang / yo byad kyis yongs su bstud pa dang / sbyor ba mnyam par yongs su gtong bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ / yang dag par blangs pa mi gtong ba dang / gnas med pa dang / nga rgyal med pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ / nyes pa thams cad khyad du gsod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid la gzhol ba dang / mthon dman med pa dang / zad mi shes pa'i sa mnyam par 'dzin pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ / brtsam pa chen por rtsom pa dang / brtsam pa thams cad la zhum pa med pa dang / sbyor ba phyir mi ldog pa dang / yid la byed pa phyir mi 'gyur ba dang / mthu mtha' yas pa dang / stobs la thub pa med pa dang / sngon du 'dor ba mi 'phrog pa dang / dad pa'i mthu chen po dang / blang pa dang dor ba med pa'i tshogs thams cad yongs su rgyas par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo nyams pa med pa la yang dag par 'jug pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi 'du 'dzi yongs su sbyong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / rim gyis bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin mngon par sgrub pa dang / gnas med cing blang ba med pa shin tu rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu sel pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sgo mtha' yas pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / mngon par shes pa chen pos rnam par 'phrul pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / rim gyis rnam par spong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la rab tu 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gcig la sgo mtha' yas pa rab tu 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul thams cad shes pa dang / de'i yul gyi rjes su rab tu zhugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad ye shes kyi phyag rgya mi 'khrug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la nye bar gyur pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / blang ba dang / bcang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur bas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / thos pa thams cad kyis mi ngom pa dang / ji ltar thos pa la tshul bzhin du rtog pa dang / de la mngon sum du mnyam par gzhog pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i lta ba thams cad dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi phyag rgya tha mi dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgo nas lhun gyis grub par sgom zhing rnam par sgom pa dang / stobs la 'jug pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgo kun dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgor 'jug pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ /

“When enlightening beings expound the Teaching to sentient beings in this way, they practice it themselves, increasing its benefit, not giving up the ways of transcendence, fully setting out the path of the transcendent practices. At this time, enlightening beings give up everything external and internal, without attachment, to satisfy the hearts of sentient beings — thus they can purify the transcendent practice of giving. They keep ethical precepts without attachment, forever divorcing conceit — thus they can purify the transcendent practice of morality. They are able to tolerate all evils, with minds equanimous toward all beings, without disturbance or wavering, just like the earth, able to bear all—thus they can purify the transcendent practice of forbearance. They undertake all practices without laziness, never regressing in what they do, with indomitable courage and energy, not grasping or rejecting all virtues, but able to fulfill all aspects of knowledge — thus they can purify the transcendent practice of vigor. They have no attachment or greed for any objects of desire, are able to consummate the successive degrees of concentration, always meditate correctly, neither dwelling in or leaving concentration, yet able to dissolve all afflictions, produce innumerable facets of concentration, develop boundless great psychic powers, going back and forth successively from meditation state to meditation state, in one meditation enter boundless meditations, knowing all spheres of meditation, not discordant with the seal of knowledge of all concentrations and trances, able to quickly enter the stage of omniscience—thus they can purify the transcendent practice of meditation. Hearing the Teaching from the Buddhas and accepting and keeping it, associating with wise companions, serving them tirelessly, always glad to hear the teaching, never growing weary of it, thinking about what is heard according to the true principle, entering genuine concentration, divorcing all biased views, observing all things well, apprehending the definite mark of the character of reality, comprehending the effortless path of the Enlightened, riding on universal wisdom, entering the gate of the knowledge of all knowledge, attaining eternal rest — thus can they purify transcendent wisdom.

'jig rten gyi bya ba'i rgyud thams cad ston pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / bsam pa bzhin du bya ba ston pa dang / bya ba thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa dang / byis pa'i spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i spyod pa bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar ston pa dang / sbyor ba thams cad shin tu brtags pas rgyu ba dang / rgyan thams cad bstan pa gnas med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang ba dang / sems can thams cad sgrol ba'i spyod pas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong ngo/ /

“Manifesting all worldly occupations to teach living beings, never getting tired of it, appearing to them in forms pleasing to them, having no attachments to anything done, sometimes manifesting the acts of ordinary people, sometimes manifesting the acts of sages, sometimes manifesting birth and death, sometimes manifesting nirvana, able to keenly observe all doings and manifest all adornments without covetousness, entering all realms of existence to liberate sentient beings—thus can they purify the transcendent practice of skill in means.

sems can gyi khams mthar thug par yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mthar thug par yongs su sbyang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthar thug par mchod pa dang / chos chags pa med pa'i mthar thug par rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bskal pa phyi ma'i mthar thug par rab tu gnas pa dang / sems bskyed pa'i mthar thug par stobs la 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba dang ldog pa mthar thug par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / zhing gi gnas kyi mthar thug par thams cad mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa rab tu thob par bya bas smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ /

“Thoroughly developing all living beings, thoroughly adorning all worlds, making offerings to all Buddhas, completely arriving at the state of nonobstruction, thoroughly cultivating practice extending throughout the universe, physically remaining throughout all times, knowing the thoughts of all minds, being fully aware that all cyclic transformations return to extinction, appearing in all lands, completely realizing the knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened—thus they can purify the transcendent practice of vows.

bsam pa'i stobs kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dbang du gyur cing thub pa med pa dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs skyo ba med pa dang / byams pa chen po'i stobs snyoms pa'i sbyor ba can dang / gzungs kyi stobs don thams cad kyi sbyor ba la bsgribs pa med pa dang / spobs pa'i stobs 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs theg pa thams cad kyi rgyan byed pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs gcad du mi rung ba dang / mngon par shes pa'i stobs tshad med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs la mos pa dam pa'i stobs rab tu 'dzin pas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ /

“Replete with the power of profound will, being without defilement, replete with the power of profound faith, being invincible, replete with the power of great compassion, never being wearied, replete with the power of great kindness, being impartial in action, replete with memory power, being able to skillfully retain all meanings, replete with the power of elucidation, causing all beings to be happy and fulfilled, replete with the power of transcendent practices, adorning the great vehicle, replete with the power of vows, never ceasing, replete with the power of spiritual abilities, producing innumerable miracles, replete with the power of strengthening and sustaining, able to induce faith and acceptance—thus can they purify the transcendent practice of power.

'dod chags kyi spyod pa khong du chud pa dang / zhe sdang gi spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / gti mug gi spyod pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / cha mnyam pa'i spyod pa rjes su shes pa dang / slob pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / skad cig gcig gis sems can mtha' yas pa'i spyod pa rnam par rtogs pa dang / sems dang bsam pa mtha' yas pa thams cad shes par byed pa dang / chos thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sgo thams cad dang ldan pa khong du chud pas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par byed do/ /

“Knowing those who act on covetousness, knowing those who act on anger, knowing those who act on folly, knowing those who act equally on all of these, knowing those who cultivate learning, in a single thought knowing the actions of boundless sentient beings, knowing the minds of boundless sentient beings, knowing the truth of all things, knowing the powers of all enlightened ones, being aware of all aspects of the cosmos of reality—thus can they purify the transcendent practice of knowledge.
bam po nyi shu lnga pa/

de dag de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su sbyong zhing / pha rol tu phyin pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / pha rol gyi phyogs mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rgya chen po'i rgyan dang ldan pa la gnas shing sems can gyi khams ji ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du yang dag par sgrol lo/ /de dag dge ba'i las shin tu bsags pa ston pas ngan song du 'gro ba'i sems can sgrol lo/ /brtsam pa chen po la gzud pas sems can gyi khams mi khom par 'gro ba sgrol lo/ /lhag mthong nye bar bstabs pas gzugs kyi khams na 'khod pa'i sems can gyi khams sgrol lo/ /phra ba'i ye shes nye bar bstabs pas gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sems can rnams sgrol lo/ /zhi ba'i tshul nye bar bstabs pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa'i sems can gyi khams sgrol lo; ;stobs bcu'i rgyan chen po dang ldan pa bstabs pas theg pa chen po la mos pa'i sems can gyi khams sgrol lo/ /

“Child of Buddha, when enlightening beings thus purify the transcendent practices, fulfill the transcendent practices, do not give up the transcendent practices, they abide in the magnificently adorned vehicle of enlightening beings, and expound the Teaching to all sentient beings who come to their attention, causing them to increase pure conduct and attain liberation. Those who have fallen into evil ways they cause to aspire to enlightenment, those in difficulty they cause to diligently persevere. To the greedy they teach desirelessness.
