The wrathful they induce to practice equanimity. To those attached to views they explain interdependent origination. Beings in the realm of desire they teach to divorce unwholesome things like craving and hatred. To beings in the realm of form they teach analytic insight. To beings in the formless realm they expound subtle wisdom. To people of the two lesser vehicles they teach the practice of dispassion and tranquility. To those who like the great vehicle they expound the great adornment of the ten powers.

de ltar na/ sngon las dang po pa'i sa la gnas pa'i tshe sems can g.yang sa chen po nas lhung ba rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes te sgo sna tshogs nas gzud par bya'o/ /zhes seng+ge'i sgra bsgrags pa de bzhin du ye shes thob pa rnams sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin no/ /

“As in the past when they first aspired to enlightenment they saw innumerable beings fallen into evil ways, they made the great lion’s roar and said, ‘I should by means of various teachings appropriate to their needs and potentials rescue and liberate them’; enlightening beings, replete with such knowledge and wisdom, are able to liberate all sentient beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ /byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu la zhugs pa ni/ rtag tu rgyun mi gcod par sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos kyi rigs dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin te/ de dag byang chub kyi sems gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la gzhol bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ chos kyi mdzod rnam par 'grel pas chos kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ bstan pa'i tshul dang 'gal bar mi byed pas dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ smon lam chen po yang dag par brjod pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul yang dag par ston pas chos kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ snying po thob par byed pa'i chos la brtson pas dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bon sems can gyi zhing la 'debs pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pas chos kyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ tshogs chen po yongs su sdud pa la mi skyo bas dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa dran pa'i phyir rtag tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mi gtong pas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa yin/

“Child of Buddha, enlightening beings, endowed with such knowledge and wisdom, cause the lineage of the three treasures never to end. How? Great enlightening beings teach creatures to awaken the will for enlightenment, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of Buddhas not to be broken off. They always expound the treasury of the Teaching for sentient beings, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of the Teaching not to be cut off. They maintain the principles of the Teaching well, without opposition or violation, and therefore can cause the lineage of the religious community not to be cut off. Furthermore, they are able to praise all great vows, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of Buddhas not to be cut off. They analyze and explain the aspects of causality, and are therefore able to cause the lineage of the Teaching not to be cut off. They always earnestly practice the six principles of harmony and respect and therefore are able to cause the lineage of the religious community not to be cut off. Also, they plant the seeds of buddhahood in the field of sentient beings, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of Buddhas not to be cut off; they protect and keep the Teaching unreservedly, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of the Teaching not to be cut off; they unify and order the great community tirelessly, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of the religious community not to be cut off. Also, they serve and uphold the teachings spoken and the precepts established by the Buddhas of past, present, and future, and therefore are able to cause the lineage of the Buddha, Teaching, and Community to never be cut off.

de dag de ltar skyabs gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pas rtsom pa thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa yin te/ brtsam pa gang ci rtsom yang rung / de dag thams cad du thogs pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgor 'byung ba thob bar byed do/ / de dag de ltar lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa la gnas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsom pa don yod par rtsom pa yin te/ sems can gyi don sbyor ba don yod par rtsom mo/ / sems can don yod par 'dul bar byed do/ / chos don yod par ston to; ; de'i chos bstan pa thams cad kyang sems can gyi bsam pa tshim par bya ba la thogs pa med pas khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ / de'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang log par mi 'gyur te/ sems bskyed pa gzhan thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Thus enlightening beings succeed to the Three Treasures, free from error in all they do: all of their actions they dedicate to omniscience, and therefore their physical, verbal, and mental actions are free from flaws; being free from flaws, all the good deeds they do, all the practices they carry out, edifying beings, teaching them according to their needs, are never in error even for a moment; all are in consonance with skill and knowledge, all are dedicated to omniscient knowledge, none passing in vain.

de de ltar chos dkar po bsags pa don yod pa de lta bu la gnas pas/ rgyan rnam par phye ba bcus sems bskyed pa thams cad yongs su bsngo ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lus kyi rgyan sems can 'dul ba ji bzhin du yang dag par ston pa dang / ngag gi rgyan the tshom thams cad gcod pa dang / sems kyi rgyan skad cig gcig gis ting nge 'dzin rjes su rtogs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'od kyi rgyan 'od zer gyi dra ba mtha' dang dbus med pa bkye bas 'gro ba thams cad snang bar byed pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan sems can gyi rnam pa tshad med pa'i tshogs yongs su mgu bar byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba dang / bstan pa'i rgyan mkhas pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyan mngon par sangs rgyas pa gcig gis phyogs bcu ma lus par rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / chos byin gyis brlab pa'i rgyan yul dang / dus dang / snod ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dag ste/

“Cultivating and practicing good ways like this, enlightening beings fulfill ten kinds of adornments moment after moment: adornment of bodies—they appear as appropriate to beings who can be taught; adornment of speech—they cut off all doubts and cause everyone to rejoice; adornment of mind—they enter all meditations in a single instant; adornment of buddha-lands—all are pure, free from afflictions; adornment of auras—they radiate boundless light, illumining sentient beings everywhere; adornment of community—they unify communities and gladden them all; adornment of spiritual powers—they can appear freely, adapting to the minds of sentient beings; adornment of true teaching—they are able to attract all intelligent people; adornment of the state of nirvana—becoming enlightened in one place, they pervade the whole universe; adornment of skillful explanation—they teach in accord with the place, the time, the faculty, and capacity.

de dag rgyan de lta bus sems bskyed pa thams cad du mngon par sgrub pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las don yod pa dang / ye shes chen po don yod pa rab tu 'thob ste/ de dag mthong bas kyang 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can rnams la don yod pa yin te/ thos pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / 'grogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rjes su rab tu byung ba dang / chos ston pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang pa dang / dad cing mos pa dang / chung ngu na ming brjod pa tsam yang 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin pa'i phyir sems can rnams la don du 'gyur ba yin no/ /

“Perfecting these adornments, the physical, verbal, and mental actions of enlightening beings, moment after moment, are never wasted; all they dedicate to entering into omniscience. If any sentient beings see these enlightening beings, know that this also will not be in vain, for they will surely attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment. Any who hear their names, or make offerings to them, or live with them, or remember them, or leave home to follow them, or listen to them preach, or rejoice in their virtues, or respect them from afar, or even praise their names, will all attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi'i ming mthong na bde ba zhes bya ba de mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi lus la zhen pa'am/ ltor zos pa'i dug rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du chos de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad byang bar 'gyur te/ chos dkar po'i stobs kyi shugs kyang skye bar 'gyur ro/ /

“For example, it is as though there were a medicine, called ‘good to see,’ which removed all toxins from those who saw it; so it is with enlightening beings who have accomplished this teaching—if sentient beings see them, all the poisons of afflictions will be destroyed, and wholesome states will increase.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos nyid de lta bu dang ldan zhing chos de dag la gnas te shes rab kyi 'od chen pos ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal nas bdud kyi dkrugs ma'i 'khor thams cad byams pa dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs kyis pham par byas te ye shes dang / bsod nams kyi stobs kyi shugs kyis phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis mnan nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pas/ sems kyi dri ma thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad bsal nas skyo ba med pa'i stobs dang shugs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rab tu sgrub ste/ sngon chad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par spyad pa'i stobs dang shugs kyis mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad rnam par bzlog nas mngon par zhen pa med pa'i stobs dang shugs kyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyangs te/ rim gyis thabs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang shugs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su dag pa mngon par bsgrubs nas chos dkar po thams cad kyi stobs dang / shugs kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan yongs su dag pa mngon par sgrub pa rab tu rgyas par byas te/ ye shes kyi shes par bya ba'i dbang dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang myur du 'thob cing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul yang smon lam gyi khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du 'thob par 'gyur ro/ / sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mngon par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing bstan te/ 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor cing mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnam par 'dul lo/ /

“Enlightening beings, abiding by this teaching and earnestly applying it, destroy the darkness of ignorance by means of the light of wisdom; they conquer the armies of demons by the power of compassion; they check heretics by means of great knowledge and the power of virtue; they wipe out all afflictions staining the mind by means of adamantine concentration; they gather roots of goodness by the power of diligence; they avoid the difficulties of evil ways by means of the power of virtues of purifying buddha-lands; they purify their spheres of knowledge by the power of nonattachment; by the power of skill in means and knowledge they produce the transcendent practices of the stages of enlightening, as well as the various concentrations, six superknowledges, and four fearlessnesses, making them all pure; by the power of all virtues they fully develop the pure lands of all Buddhas, their boundless distinguishing marks and refinements, and complete physical, verbal, and mental adornments; by the power of observation with independent knowledge they know the powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of all enlightened ones are equal; by the power of vast knowledge they comprehend the realm of omniscience; by the power of their past vows they manifest buddha-lands according to the needs of those to be taught, turn the wheel of the great teaching, and liberate innumerable living beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos de lta bu dang ldan pa dag ni/ tshul de lta bus sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thob nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag tu dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin cing chos smra ba chen po'ang byed do/ / de ltar chos smra ba byed pa'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag chos kyi mdzod chen po gzung zhing bsrung ba'i phyir tha dad pa yang dag par shes pas chos kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba'i rjes su song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' yas par bdag gi lus kyi rgyan byin gyis brlabs te/ bstan pa mngon par sgrub pa rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i mkhas pa mtha' yas pa dang / ye shes mi zad pa'i sgor 'jug pa dang / dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor shin tu rnam par phye ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / dbyangs gcig bsgrags pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / shes pa'i sa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'brang ba dang / lus kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi nang du phyin kyang zil gyis mi non pa dang / lus kyi rgyan sgo thams cad du rnam par bstan pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa khong du chud pas rab tu rtogs pa dang / tshig grol ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan pa dang / chos 'chad pa'i byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pas chos kyi gtam chen po byed de/ stobs dang shugs kyi dbang thub pa med pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa'i dbang zhum pa med pa dang / chos kyi dbang zil gyis mi non pa dang / ye shes kyi dbang gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang chos kyi mtshan nyid 'khrugs pa med pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i dbang mtshams sbyor ba rgyun chad pa med par bsam pa shin tu rtogs pa dang / gzungs kyi dbang chos thams cad rnam par gdon mi za ba la 'jug pa dang / smon lam gyi dbang dpe sna tshogs kyis bstan pa'i tshul nye bar sgrub pa shin tu bstan pa dang / snying rje chen po'i dbang phyir mi ldog cing rgyun ma chad pa dang / byams pa chen po'i dbang sngon shin tu skyes pas bsam pa thams cad sim par byed pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po gtong bas chos kyi gtam chen po byed do/ / de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge'i gdan la bzhugs shing chos kyi gtam gsung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dang smon lam gyi khyad par dang ldan pa ma gtogs par sems can gyi ris na byang chub sems dpa' de la phyir brgal ba'am/ spyi gtsug blta ba'am/ zil gyis mnan pa'am/ dri ba'i tshogs yongs su dri bas thub par bya bar nus pa'i sems can gang yang med de/ de ni/ gnas med do/ /

“Great enlightening beings diligently practice these things, gradually accomplishing all the deeds of enlightening beings, till they attain equality with the Buddhas, become great teachers in boundless worlds, maintaining the true teaching, protected by all the Buddhas, guarding and upholding the vast treasury of truth. Attaining unhindered intellect, they enter deeply into the facts of the teaching, and in boundless worlds among the great masses they manifest different physical forms, according to type, replete with supremely excellent features; with unhindered powers of elucidation they skillfully explain the profound teaching. The spheres of their speech, well rounded, skillfully reach everyone, therefore are able to cause those who hear to enter the gate of inexhaustible knowledge. Knowing the afflictions current in the minds of beings, they teach them accordingly; because the sounds of the speech they utter are completely pure, they can, preaching with ‘one sound,’ cause all to become joyful. They are physically well formed, and have great strength, so among the masses none can surpass them. Because they know sentient beings’ minds well, they are able to appear in any way. Because they explain the truth skillfully, their voice is unhindered. Because they have freedom of mind, they explain the great teaching adaptively, and no one can obstruct them. Because they have attained fearlessness, their hearts are free from cowardice. Because they are masters of teaching, none can excel them. Because they are masters of knowledge, none can surpass them. Because they are masters of transcendent wisdom, the teachings they expound are not contradictory. Because they are masters of powers of elucidation, they teach continuously with eloquence. Because they are masters of mental command, they definitively disclose the real character of all things. Because they are masters of elocution, whenever they speak they can bring forth all sorts of examples and metaphors. Because they are masters of great compassion, they diligently teach sentient beings without flagging. Because they are masters of great kindness, they emanate a great web of lights pleasing all hearts. Thus do enlightening beings, on the high and wide lion throne, expound the Great Teaching; aside from the Enlightened Ones and the great enlightening beings of surpassing will and knowledge, no other beings can excel them, none can see their crowns, none can outshine them, and no one can stump them with difficult questions.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gal te byang chub sems dpa' dbang de lta bu thob pa la 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa tsam du yangs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor zhig yod la/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de yang sems can stong gsum gyi bdag po'i gzi brjid thob pa sha stag gis gang ba zhig yin na yang de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'ongs ma thag tu lus bstan pa'i dbang gis zil gyis mnan te/ byams pa chen po'i dbang gis lus kyi gzhi tshim par byas nas ye shes chen po'i dbang gis sems dang bsam pa rnam par shes par byas te mi 'jigs pa'i bsam pa chen pos chos ston pa byed cing / spobs pa chen po'i dbang gis sems can tshim par byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de ni/ ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa dang ldan; chos rnam par 'byed pa shin tu rnam par phye ba la mkhas pa dang ldan/ dran pa'i stobs dang shugs ma nyams shing rgya che ba dang ldan/ chos thams cad kyi tshul rnam par gdon mi za bar bzung zhing blangs pas rtogs par mkhas pa dang ldan/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa mtha' dbus med pa dang ldan/ chos kyi mtshan nyid bsgribs pa med pa'i chos ston pa la mkhas pa dang ldan/ mos pa la mkhas pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis blangs pa dang ldan/ dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor du yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pa dang ldan/ sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i bsam pa bzang po rnam par dag pa la mkhas pa dang ldan pas chos smra ba chen po byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod kyang rnam par 'byed do/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi smon lam dang / ye shes 'byams klas pas dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su 'dzin to/ /

“Child of Buddha, once enlightening beings have attained such independent power, even if there were a vast sanctuary the size of unspeakably many worlds filled with beings, each of whom had the majesty of a lord of a billion worlds, as soon as any of the enlightening beings showed themselves, they would outshine the whole crowd of such beings. With great kindness and compassion they would give them security where they were afraid and weak, and with profound wisdom they would examine their inclinations and teach them with fearless eloquence, causing joy to all. Why? Because great enlightening beings have developed the sphere of immeasurable knowledge and wisdom; because they have developed immeasurable skillful discernment; because they have developed vast power of right mindfulness; because they have developed infinitely flexible intellect; because they have developed the total mental command to ascertain the true character of all things; because they have developed a boundless determination for enlightenment; because they have developed unerring powers of elucidation; because they have developed profound faith and resolve boosted by the Buddhas; because they have developed the power of knowledge to enter the assemblies of all Buddhas; because they have developed the pure mind that knows the Buddhas of all times are of the same essential nature; because they have developed the knowledge of enlightened ones of all times, and the great will and knowledge of all enlightening beings, and are able to be teachers of the truth, to open up the treasury of the true teaching of the Buddhas, and to protect and keep it.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros kyis yang byang chub sems dpa' rim gyis yang dag par 'byung ba'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to restate what he meant, the enlightening being Truth Wisdom, by the spiritual power of the Buddha uttered these verses:

bsod nams tshogs bsags byang chub sems la gnas pa rnams/ / rtag tu bag yod blo brtan mthu chen bdog pa dag / dran dang ldan zhing byang chub sems rab mi gtong bas/ / phyogs rnams bcu por bde gshegs rnams ni mnyes par byed/ /
brtson 'grus brtsams pa dran ldan mos pa brtan pa can/ / 'jig rten kun la rtag tu mi gnas mi ldog pa/ / zab pa'i chos zhugs mya ngan med pa'i tshul mkhas rnams/ / phyogs rnams bcu por bde gshegs rnams ni mnyes par byed/ /
brtson 'grus brtan pas bde gshegs mnyes par byas nas kyang / / dus gsum bsod nams tshogs dang ye shes ldan pa rnams/ / sa rnams gnod byed spyod mchog nyams pa med par byed/ / thub pa'i smon lam rdzogs byed ston pa'ang de bzhin byed/ /
ye shes gcig la zhugs pa de dag thob bya ba/ / thob nas 'gro ba kun la sbyin pa rab tu gtong / / bsam pa dag dang khams dang sbyor ba shes byas nas/ / dbang po ji bzhin mkhas pa de ltar chos kyang ston/ /
pha rol phyin la brtson pa mthu chen ldan pa rnams/ / 'gro ba rnams la chos ston bdag gi don mi gtong / / pha rol phyin rdzogs grol ba mthu chen ldan pa rnams/ / khyu mchog mthu yis 'khor ba'i mtsho las sems can sgrol/ /
de ltar nyin mtshan skyo ba med par brtson byed cing / / drang srong rgyal ba chos rigs mi gcod zhugs pa yis/ / dkar po'i spyod pa gang yang rung ste spyod pa rnams/ / thams cad don yod rgyal ba rnams kyi sar 'gro'o/ /
de dag ci spyod thams cad 'gro ba rnams la yang / / rnam smin don yod nyon mongs dri ma sbyong bar 'gyur/ / 'di 'dra'i chos ldan de dag mun pa bsal byas shing / / bdud 'khrug 'khor lo pham byas byang chub thob par byed/ /
de ltar brtson zhing ye shes thob pa'i bde gshegs sras/ / bde gshegs rnams kyi chos rab mdzod kyang rab tu ston/ / de dag chos smra'i bya ba kun kyang shin tu byed/ / bdud rtsi mchog zhim sprin gyi char yang mngon par 'bebs/ /
de dag snying rje byams pas 'gro ba kun bkang zhing / / brtan pa de rnams 'khor gyi bsam pa shes byas nas/ / gang gi bsam pa blo gros sems rgyud ci 'dra ba/ / de bzhin rgyal ba'i chos ni stong phrag du ma ston/
glang po'i stabs sdug tshul bzang 'gros su 'gro ba rnams/ / seng+ge'i rtsal ltar rtag tu sus kyang mi thub cing / / ye shes rgya mtsho lta bu ri rab bzhin gnas pa/ / sprin ltar 'gro ba kun gyi nyon mongs zhi bar byed/ /

Mind dwelling on enlightenment, gathering myriad virtues, Never self-indulgent, planting unshakable wisdom, Always mindful of the aspiration for enlightenment— At this all Buddhas rejoice.
Mindfulness and will firm, self-motivated, Relying on nothing in the world, and never shrinking in fright, Entering the profound truth by the practice of noncontention— At this the Buddhas all rejoice.
Once the Buddhas rejoice, enlightening beings are firm in effort— They cultivate virtue and wisdom, and all that assists the Path. Entering into the pure practices of all the stages, They fulfill the aspiration spoken of by the Enlightened.
Practicing this, they attain the wondrous truth, And having attained to truth, they pass it on to others— According to mentalities, faculties, and natures, They teach in accord with whatever is fitting.
Enlightening beings expound the Teaching for others Without giving up their own transcendent practices: Once they have accomplished the transcendent ways, They remain forever in the sea of existence, rescuing living beings.
They practice diligently day and night, never flagging, Causing the seeds of the three treasures not to perish. All the pure practices they carry out They dedicate to the stage of enlightenment.
The virtuous acts performed by enlightening beings Are all to develop and complete the living, To have them destroy obscurity and annihilate affliction, Subdue the demon armies and fulfill true awakening.
Thus practicing, they attain Buddha-knowledge, Entering deeply into the treasury of truth of the Enlightened. As great teachers they expound the subtle truth, Like sweet elixir refreshing all.
Their compassion and pity extends to all— They know the mind of every sentient being And expound to them in accord with their predilections Infinite, boundless enlightening teachings.
Their deportment is calm as a majestic elephant, Their fearless courage is like that of a lion: Imperturbable as a mountain, their knowledge is like an ocean, And like a great rain, removing all heat.
byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros kyis de skad ces smras pa dang / de la ston pas rjes su dgyes par mdzad do/ /
When Truth Wisdom had spoken these verses, the Buddha was delighted, and everyone reverentially put them into practice.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ chos snang ba'i le'u zhes bya ba ste/ nyi shu gsum pa'o// //
